Croatia and Montenegro

Description.Title: Our strengths
Description.Text: Enjoy a breath-taking journey throughout the beautiful landscapes of Croatia and Montenegro, in which you will discover beautiful cities as well as places where nature is queen. Dive into the striking beauty of the Dalmatian coast, stroll through Dubrovnik "the pearl of the Adriatic", Trogir, Hvar, Korcula or Kotor, as well as the national parks of Mljet and Krka.

Description.Title: Highlights
Description.Text:
CRUISE HIGHLIGHTS

  • Fantastic variety of architecture(1)
  • Stunning landscapes and the splendid Bay of Kotor(1)
  • Each island is more beautiful than the last(1)
  • Untamed spectacle of natural waterfalls(1)
  • Beautiful walled cities along the Dalmatian Coast(1)

Description.Title: This offer includes
Description.Text: Your cruise with all meals from dinner the first evening to breakfast on the final day - onboard drinks included (except for drinks from our special lists) - double-occupancy cabin with shower in bathroom - excursions included in the package selected - assistance from our onboard multi-lingual host/hostess - welcome cocktail - gala dinner - onboard entertainment - travel assistance and repatriation insurance - all port fees.

Description.Title: This offer does not include
Description.Text: Drinks from our special lists, or drinks ordered during excursions or transfers - cancellation and baggage insurance - transfers/travel to and from departure/arrival points - personal expenses.

Description.Title: DUBROVNIK (Croatia)
Description.Text: Passengers are welcome to board our ship at 6:00 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we'll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. Presentation of the hiking program followed by dinner on board. The evening is free to do as you please.

Description.Title: DUBROVNIK (Croatia)
Description.Text: Passengers are welcome to board our ship at 6:00 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we'll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. Presentation of the hiking program followed by dinner on board. The evening is free to do as you please.

Description.Title: DUBROVNIK - MLJET
Description.Text:
We’ll set out this morning for a guided visit of Dubrovnik, nicknamed "the Pearl of the Adriatic". With its exceptional medieval architecture and its streets paved with marble, the former city of Ragusa is now a must-see place of the Adriatic coast. During our visit we’ll discover the Roman-style Franciscan Church and Monastery built in the 13th century and the Rector's Palace which was the former seat of the government and is now a museum. Our visit will take us to the Assumption cathedral, the St Blaise's Church and the magnificent Sponza Palace built in a mixed Gothic and Renaissance style.

This afternoon:

Non-walker’s Program: Enjoy some time at leisure to discover Dubrovnik. We suggest a stroll around the ramparts(1) which were built to protect the city. Once on top, enjoy a wonderful view over the old town.

Walkers’ Program: Hike to the ruins of the Imperial Fort, with breathtaking views overlooking Dubrovnik's bay. We’ll leave by coach towards the eastside of the city. We’ll climb the Sr¿ Hill passing along the Bosanka village before reaching the ruins.  (Length 2½ to 3 hours, distance of 5 km (3 miles), with a climb of about 400m (1,315 feet.)

Enjoy an evening of dancing as our ship cruises through the night.

Description.Title: DUBROVNIK - MLJET
Description.Text:
We’ll set out this morning for a guided visit of Dubrovnik, nicknamed "the Pearl of the Adriatic".

This afternoon:
Non-walker’s Program: Enjoy some time at leisure to discover Dubrovnik. We suggest a stroll around the ramparts(1) which were built to protect the city. Once on top, enjoy a wonderful view over the old town.
Walkers’ Program: Hike to the ruins of the Imperial Fort, with breathtaking views overlooking Dubrovnik's bay. (Length 2½ to 3 hours, distance of 5 km (3 miles), with a climb of about 400m (1,315 feet.)

Enjoy an evening of dancing as our ship cruises through the night.

Description.Title: MLJET - KORCULA
Description.Text:
We’ll leave for an excursion to Mljet. The greenest Croatian island with its breathtaking natural beauty, clear blue sea and the vast lakes of Malo Jezero and Veliko Jezero, is one of the most beautiful islands of the Adriatic. A Benedictine monastery is located on a tiny island in the middle of Veliko Jezero.

Walkers’ Program: Walk in the Mljet National Park. After our excursion to the Benedictine monastery, we'll have a short hike towards Pomena (Total length 2½ hours, distance of 4 km (2.5 miles), with a climb of about 100m (328 feet).).

We'll return on board at the end of the morning and start cruising to Korcula, one of the large islands of the Adriatic with a hilly landscape.

Non-walker’s Program: Tour of the city and its museum. During our tour we’ll discover, among others, the Cathedral of St Mark built between the 15th and 16th centuries. The museum is located in Gabrielis palace and has various collections covering Korcula’s history and culture from Ancient history to nowadays.

Walkers’ Program: Hiking in Hober Park and St Anton. The park is a protected area where you can admire the bay of Luka Korculanska. An interesting place in Hober Park is Naplov, a large drainage area, which was used to collect rain water before Korcula’s waterworks where installed. A path will take us to St Anton Church located on top of the hill. (Length 4 hours, distance of 10 km (6 miles), with a climb of about 300m (984 feet).)

Enjoy a traditional sword dancing evening. We'll start cruising towards Korcula.

Description.Title: MLJET - KORCULA
Description.Text:
We’ll leave for an excursion to Mljet.

Walkers’ Program: Walk in the Mljet National Park. After our excursion to the Benedictine monastery, we'll have a short hike towards Pomena (Total length 2½ hours, distance of 4 km (2.5 miles), with a climb of about 100m (328 feet)).

We'll return on board at the end of the morning and start cruising to Korcula.

Non-walker’s Program: Tour of the city and its museum.
Walkers’ Program: Hiking in Hober Park and St Anton. (Length 4 hours, distance of 10 km (6 miles), with a climb of about 300m (984 feet).)

Enjoy a traditional sword dancing evening. We'll start cruising towards Korcula.

Description.Title: KORCULA - SIBENIK
Description.Text:
This morning will be spent cruising through an exceptional landscape, passing the islands of Hvar, Brac, and Split along the way.

Non-walker’s Program: Tour of Sibenik, the oldest Slavic city of the Adriatic and the Krka falls. Also known as "the fortress city", the beautiful town of Sibenik is the oldest native Croatian city on the Adriatic. You’ll have the chance to see the Cathedral of St. James, the most important architectural monument of the Renaissance in the entire country. We’ll then head to the astonishing Krka Falls. This unique environment, home to an especially rich fauna and flora, will take your breath away.

Walkers’ Program: Hike through the Krka National Park on walkways leading past lakes and waterfalls. You’ll be amazed by the unique scenery offered by the impressive collection of 17 waterfalls that range by over 45 meters in height. (Length 4½ hours, distance of 8 km (5 miles), with a climb of about 250m (820 feet).)

Enjoy an evening of onboard entertainment.

Description.Title: KORCULA - SIBENIK
Description.Text:
This morning will be spent cruising through an exceptional landscape, passing the islands of Hvar, Brac, and Split along the way.

Non-walker’s Program: Tour of Sibenik, the oldest Slavic city of the Adriatic and the Krka falls.
Walkers’ Program: Hike through the Krka National Park on walkways leading past lakes and waterfalls. (Length 4½ hours, distance of 8 km (5 miles), with a climb of about 250m (820 feet).)

Enjoy an evening of onboard entertainment.

Description.Title: SIBENIK - TROGIR - SPLIT
Description.Text: Join us for a guided tour of Trogir. Long considered one of the best spots to visit on the Dalmatian coast, Trogir is a treasure trove of delights. Wander through the narrow alleys and retrace the city's 2,500 years of history. Afterwards, we'll cruise towards Split and set out on a guided tour of the Diocletian’s Palace, historic jewel of the city. The charm of this beautiful city lies in its lovely streets and its Old Town built in the heart of Diocletian's Palace, one of the most imposing Roman ruins and some of the most valuable surviving buildings of that era on the Adriatic coast. This evening is free to do as you please.

Description.Title: SIBENIK - TROGIR - SPLIT
Description.Text: Join us for a guided tour of Trogir. Afterwards, we'll cruise towards Split and set out on a guided tour of the Diocletian’s Palace, historic jewel of the city. This evening is free to do as you please.

Description.Title: SPLIT - VIS - HVAR
Description.Text:
We'll reach Hvar, the queen of Dalmatian islands.

Non-walker’s Program: Guided tour of Hvar, the Croatian Saint-Tropez. Discover the magnificent landscapes and the rich cultural heritage of the sunniest island in Croatia.

Walkers’ Program: Hike on Hvar Island where many historic monuments bear witness to the turbulent past of Croatia. Besides admiring the exquisite architecture of the fortress, you will experience an unforgettable panoramic view of the city of Hvar and the Pakleni islands. This excursion is the best way to discover the hidden treasures of Hvar Town. (Length 4½ hours, distance of 12 km (7½ miles), with a climb of about 460m (1,500 feet) - good climbing boots and telescopic trekking poles are highly recommended (not provided).)

After our tours, we'll return on board and start cruising towards Vis. Enjoy time at leisure to discover the city. Tonight's our gala dinner and evening. During the night, our ship will cruise towards Kotor.

Description.Title: SPLIT - VIS - HVAR
Description.Text:
We'll reach Hvar, the queen of Dalmatian islands.

Non-walker’s Program: Guided tour of Hvar, the Croatian Saint-Tropez.
Walkers’ Program: Hike on Hvar Island where many historic monuments bear witness to the turbulent past of Croatia. (Length 4½ hours, distance of 12 km (7½ miles), with a climb of about 460m (1,500 feet) - good climbing boots and telescopic trekking poles are highly recommended (not provided).)

After our tours, we'll return on board and start cruising towards Vis. Enjoy time at leisure to discover the city. Tonight's our gala dinner and evening. During the night, our ship will cruise towards Kotor.

Description.Title: KOTOR - DUBROVNIK
Description.Text:
We'll reach Kotor and its famous bay. The Kotor estuary is quite unique as the sea sweeps in for several miles, forming numerous calm bays.

Non-walker’s Program: Guided tour of Kotor. Wedged between brooding mountains and a moody corner of the bay, Kotor is one of the most beautiful towns on the Adriatic coast. Discover the history, legends and beautiful palaces of the city as you wander through its lovely alleys and past its fortifications built during the Venetian period.

Walkers’ Program: Hike in Kotor. After indulging in local specialties over lunch at a restaurant, we'll hike through the National Park of Lovcen which has some of the most beautiful trails in the country. Mount Lovcen is located in the park and occupies a special place in the hearts of all Montenegrins. (Length 3½ hours, distance of 8 km (5 miles), with a downward climb of about 850m (2,788 feet) - good climbing boots and telescopic trekking poles are necessary (not provided.))

We’ll return on board and start cruising towards Dubrovnik.

Description.Title: KOTOR - DUBROVNIK
Description.Text:
We'll reach Kotor and its famous bay. The Kotor estuary is quite unique as the sea sweeps in for several miles, forming numerous calm bays.

Non-walker’s Program: Guided tour of Kotor.
Walkers’ Program: Hike in Kotor. After indulging in local specialties over lunch at a restaurant, we'll hike through the National Park of Lovcen which has some of the most beautiful trails in the country. (Length 3½ hours, distance of 8 km (5 miles), with a downward climb of about 850m (2,788 feet) - good climbing boots and telescopic trekking poles are necessary (not provided.))

We’ll return on board and start cruising towards Dubrovnik.

Description.Title: Our strengths
Description.Text: Join in on a breathtaking cruise across the Adriatic Sea through the beautiful landscapes of Croatia and Montenegro. You'll be able to hike across many nature parks that are among the most rigorously preserved in Europe, all the while discovering the countryside and dazzling landscapes on the most beautiful islands of the Dalmatian coast.

Description.Title: Highlights
Description.Text:
CRUISE HIGHLIGHTS

  • Walking tours with a qualified guide:
    • Hike in the idyllic islands of the Dalmatian coast
    • The beautiful bay of Dubrovnik
    • Mljet and Krka National Parks
    • Hvar and Lovcen Natural Park
  • Non-walkers’ program:
    • Mljet, one of the most beautiful islands of the Adriatic
    • Sibenik and the Krka Falls
    • Hvar and Kotor
  • EXCURSIONS INCLUDED:
    • Dubrovnik and its marble streets
    • Trogir, a medieval city
    • The Diocletian Palace in the historic heart of Split

Description.Title: Additional information
Description.Text:
Level : 3 out of 5
The hikes that are proposed during our cruises are 2 to 5 hours walks, implying changes in altitude that range between 150 and 850 meters (500 to 2800 ft.) depending on the destination. During the hike, you'll get a chance to see and discover some of the natural and cultural areas on your cruise's program.
The lengths of time indicated for the hikes in the program are given as rough estimates and do not include time taken for breaks.
No athletic training is necessary for these hikes, but you should be in good shape and well-rested to fully enjoy this cruise.

Equipment needed
Backpack
You'll need to bring a backpack (max 30 liters / 1,830 cubic inches) to carry the things you'll need for the hike: sweater, raincoat, picnic, bottle of water and sunscreen.
So that you'll be comfortable and enjoy your hike, make sure that you choose a good backpack. We recommend a backpack that is well-made and of the appropriate size, with padded straps, and made of strong fabric that is waterproof. You must carry all materials for your hike yourself, as no porter services are provided.
 

Shoes
Most importantly, you should bring a pair of good-fitting, comfortable shoes. It is best that you use these shoes prior to leaving for your cruise. It is important that you be comfortable in them.
Regardless of the level of difficulty of the hike, your shoes should have a good quality, well sewn-on and non-slip sole for wet or uneven terrain. It is best to choose shoes that provide ankle support and that have shock-absorbing soles to prevent injury to ankles, and back and joint problems.
 

Clothes
You'll be well-prepared for your hike with these essentials:
Undergarments / base layers that are appropriate for the planned hike
Lightweight, quick-drying pants
Warm sweater or fleece jacket
Rain poncho or raincoat
Hat or cap
Thin gloves and a knit cap for the beginning and the end of the season
 

Equipment
Do not forget to bring:
Sunglasses
Sunscreen
Small personal first-aid kit (refer to the following paragraph)
Water bottle
Toilet paper
Folding knife
Telescoping hiking poles if you are used to using them
 

First-aid needs
Your guide will have a first-aid kit for each hike.
Even so, you must bring your own first-aid kit, which differs according to the destination, but will at least include:
Plastic strip bandages
"2nd Skin” or similar blister treatment bandages
Pain reliever
If necessary, mosquito repellent
Eye drops
Anti-diarrhea medication, etc.
You should also include any of your personal medication that you require (prescriptions, for example).

Description.Title: DUBROVNIK
Description.Text: Passengers are welcome to board our ship at 6 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we’ll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. We’ll enjoy dinner on board. The rest of the evening is yours to do as you please.

Description.Title: DUBROVNIK
Description.Text: Passengers are welcome to board our ship at 6 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we’ll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. We’ll enjoy dinner on board. The rest of the evening is yours to do as you please.

Description.Title: DUBROVNIK - MLJET
Description.Text:
Dubrovnik stands boldly under limestone mountain peaks along the rocky coastline of the gorgeous sea. It is no wonder why Lord Byron described it as the “Pearl of the Adriatic.” Once the center of the Republic of Ragusa, the city’s medieval wall and stone streets are now famous worldwide as the main filming location for King’s Landing in Game of Thrones.

This morning, join us for an excursion:

CLASSIC/FAMILY: Guided tour of Dubrovnik. Dubrovnik is a precious gem that adorns the coast along the Adriatic Sea. Discover the natural beauty and rich history of this majestic city.

In the afternoon, join us for:

FAMILY/CHILDREN: Swimming on Lokrum Island. Lush Lokrum Island is a natural reserve with stone and pebble beaches and swimming nooks. Hop on a local ferry to enjoy an afternoon of swimming in the turquoise waters. 

Or, take advantage of some free time on your own. We suggest a walk along the fortified walls, which completely enclose the old city, are about 1.25 miles long, and reach up to 82 feet high.(1) You’re guaranteed a fantastic view from up there!

After we return on board, we’ll begin to cruise to Mljet. Our ship will cruise through the night.

Description.Title: DUBROVNIK - MLJET
Description.Text:
Excursion offered in the morning:

CLASSIC/FAMILY: Guided tour of Dubrovnik.

Excursion proposed in the afternoon: 

FAMILY/KIDS: Swimming on Lokrum Island. 

Or, free time on your own. We suggest a walk along the city walls.(1)

Description.Title: MLJET - KORCULA
Description.Text:
We’ll arrive in Mljet early in the morning. Join us for an excursion:

CLASSIC/FAMILY/KIDS: Visit Mljet National Park. Once in the park, we’ll set out in rowboats to reach the small island sitting in the middle of a salt lake. We’ll visit the former Benedictine monastery, and you can spend some free time exploring the site on your own.

After our excursion, we’ll return to the ship and begin to cruise to Korcula.

The excursion proposed in the afternoon:

CLASSIC/FAMILY: Guided tour of Korcula. We’ll walk through the town and visit the Cathedral of St. Mark, built by local stonemasons from the 14th to 16th centuries with the help of Italian masters. The facade is decorated with intriguing figures and reliefs. The bell tower is the work of Marko Andrijic, a famous local architect and stonemason.

Tonight’s entertainment will be traditional sword dancing. We’ll begin to cruise to Sibenik during the night.

Description.Title: MLJET - KORCULA
Description.Text:
Excursion proposed:

CLASSIC/FAMILY/KIDS: Visit Mljet National Park on one of the most beautiful islands on the Adriatic.

Excursion proposed in the afternoon:

CLASSIC/FAMILY: Guided tour of charming Korcula.

Tonight’s entertainment will be traditional sword dancing.

Description.Title: KORCULA - SIBENIK
Description.Text:
You’ll arrive in Sibenik during the morning. In the afternoon, we offer two excursions:

CLASSIC: Visit Sibenik and Krka Falls. Sibenik is in the central part of the Croatian Adriatic Coast, in the picturesque and indented bay where the Krka River enters the sea. We’ll tour the historical heart and its labyrinth of streets dating back to the 15th century. Afterwards, we’ll take a coach to Krka Falls. This beautiful site contains a large and clear natural pool with high waterfalls at one end and smaller cascades at the other. After our excursion, we’ll return to the ship.

FAMILY/KIDS: Falconry Center. Discover the just how wonderful and fascinating falcons are! The center, located in a beautiful pine forest, is the perfect place to learn all there is about these amazing creatures. After our excursion, we’ll return to the ship.

Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment. We’ll begin our cruise to Trogir during the night.

Description.Title: KORCULA - SIBENIK
Description.Text:
We’ll spend the morning cruising. Excursions proposed:

CLASSIC: Visit Sibenik, the oldest Slavic city on the Adriatic Sea, and Krka Falls.

FAMILY/KIDS: Falconry Center. Discover just how wonderful and fascinating falcons are!

Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: SIBENIK - TROGIR - SPLIT
Description.Text:
We’ll arrive in Trogir early in the morning. CLASSIC/FAMILY excursion: Tour of Trogir. Trogir is the prettiest medieval town in the region. Set on an island, the preserved old town is known for its mix of architecture and cobblestone streets. The imposing cathedral is the most stunning example of the variety of architecture.

At the end of our morning, we’ll return on board the ship. Our ship will begin to cruise to Split, arriving at 3 p.m.

In the afternoon, we offer two excursions:

CLASSIC: Guided tour of Split. Split is the second-largest city in Croatia and the heart of central Dalmatia. Diocletian’s Palace, now a UNESCO World Heritage Site, was built by the Romans. Since the 7th century, the palace has been occupied by residents making their homes and businesses directly in the walls.

FAMILY/KIDS: Semi-submarine tour. What better way to look at the bottom of the sea than at the foot of the Sustipan et Katalinic hills than on a semi-submarine! Highly recommended for both kids and adults, this tour is done on a semi-submerged vessel whose cabin is 5 feet below the water level. You’ll immediately feel the magic of the sea from your “ringside” seat. This is a great way to see the local fish life without disturbing their environment.

After our excursion, we’ll return to the ship. We’ll cruise towards Hvar throughout the night.

Description.Title: SIBENIK - TROGIR - SPLIT
Description.Text:
We’ll arrive in Trogir. CLASSIC/FAMILY excursion: Tour of Trogir. Explore the city’s narrow, maze-like streets.

In the afternoon, we offer two excursions:

CLASSIC: Guided tour of Split and Diocletian's Palace—the world's most complete remains of a Roman palace.

FAMILY/KIDS: Semi-submarine tour. Discover the hidden wonders under the sea.

Description.Title: SPLIT - HVAR - VIS
Description.Text:
We’ll arrive in Hvar early in the morning. Join us for an excursion:

CLASSIC/FAMILY: Guided tour of Hvar. Hvar is a well-known summer resort island. Its long, lean mountain peaks extend from the east to the west. Posh Hvar Town is a swanky place to party and “The Place to Be.” All streets lead to the largest square in Dalmatia and the Cathedral of St. Stephen, known for its valuable treasures and paintings.

In the afternoon as an option (not included in packages): Bike across Vis Island. Vis, one of the best-preserved islands in Croatia, served as the backdrop for the sequel to Mama Mia. The island was once forbidden to tourists but now is open for all to enjoy its stony crags and amazing scenery. Low car traffic makes it the perfect place to bike. Discover Vis on two wheels as you glide past the pretty homes in quaint Mediterranean hamlets and through the vast vineyards.

In the afternoon, we'll begin to cruise towards Kotor. Our ship will cruise through the night. Tonight we’ll enjoy our gala dinner on board.

Description.Title: SPLIT - HVAR - VIS
Description.Text:
Join us for an excursion:

CLASSIC/FAMILY: Guided tour of Hvar, known as the San-Tropez of Croatia.

In the afternoon as an option (not included in packages): Discover the hidden treasures of Vis on a bike.

Tonight is our festive gala evening.

Description.Title: KOTOR - DUBROVNIK
Description.Text:
The morning will be spent cruising through the Bay of Kotor. Here, the sea spreads out into rippling gulfs and sparkling straits, each more beautiful than the other. The land is treated to an abundance of rainfall and a mild climate, creating the lush vegetation that adorns the hills. Our ship will arrive in Kotor by late morning.

CLASSIC/FAMILY excursion: Visit Kotor. The medieval city of Kotor, Montenegro, has survived the ravages of weather and wars. It’s an exciting labyrinth where the past meets the present, set against gorgeous seaside scenery.

Description.Title: KOTOR - DUBROVNIK
Description.Text: We’ll spend the morning cruising. CLASSIC/FAMILY excursion: Visit the city of Kotor, an exciting labyrinth where the past meets the present.

The amazing beauty found along the Dalmatian Coast is second to none. Stroll through the sites in Dubrovnik, Trogir, Hvar, Korcula, and Kotor, and visit unspoiled, natural havens such as Mljet and Krka Falls.

Description.Text: Join us for a visit of Dubrovnik, which captivates tourists by its beauty and sublime views. We'll spend the afternoon cruising alongside the Albanian and Montenegrin coastline. Join us for an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: DUBROVNIK
Description.Text: Join us for a visit of Dubrovnik, which captivates tourists by its beauty and sublime views. We'll spend the afternoon cruising alongside the Albanian and Montenegrin coastline. Join us for an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: CORFU (Greece)
Description.Text: We'll spend the morning cruising to the splendid island of Corfu. According to Homer's poems, Ulysses made a final stop here before returning to Ithaca. This afternoon, we'll enjoy a tour of the old city. Today a UNESCO World Heritage Site, the origins of the old city date back to the 8th century BC, but what we see today is approximately 500 years old, built mostly by the Venetians. And we'll visit the Achilleion, the island's emblematic palace built by the beloved Empress Sissi. Join us for an evening of dinner and dancing.

Description.Title: CORFU (Greece)
Description.Text: We'll spend the morning cruising to the splendid island of Corfu. According to Homer's poems, Ulysses made a final stop here before returning to Ithaca. This afternoon, we'll enjoy a tour of the old city. Today a UNESCO World Heritage Site, the origins of the old city date back to the 8th century BC, but what we see today is approximately 500 years old, built mostly by the Venetians. And we'll visit the Achilleion, the island's emblematic palace built by the beloved Empress Sissi. Join us for an evening of dinner and dancing.

Description.Title: CORFU - SARANDA (Albania)
Description.Text:
We'll cruise to Saranda in the early morning. When we arrive, join us for a visit to the Butrint ruins (an approx. 4-hour tour, including over 90 minutes of driving). These ancient ruins are famed for their size, beauty, and tranquility. They're in a fantastic natural setting and span 2,500 years. The top of the hill is where the acropolis once was; the views give you a good idea of the city's layout, and you can see the Vivari Channel connecting Lake Butrint to the Straits of Corfu in the distance.
This afternoon, we'll set out on a tour of Gjirokastër (an approx. 5-hour tour, including 3 hours of driving). Historic Gjirokastër is one of Albania's three UNESCO sites. Described as "a rare example of a well-preserved Ottoman town,¿ the city is dominated by Gjirokastër Fortress. Gjirokastër contains several remarkable examples of houses with turrets, which date from the 17th century, but also more elaborate examples dating from the early 19th century. The Gjirokastër Bazaar is known for handmade wood pieces, handwoven rugs, and crafts such as delicate lace items. We'll enjoy a tasting of local products at the end of our tour. Join us for an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: VLORE
Description.Text: Join us for a full-day tour of Apollonia and Berat (lunch included - approx. 10.5 hours long, including 4.5 hours of driving). Our first stop will be Berat. In 2008, the village was designated as a UNESCO World Heritage Site as it is a rare example of a well-preserved Ottoman town. We'll then continue on to the largest archaeological site in Albania: Apollonia. Set on rolling hills among olive groves, with impressive views all around, Apollonia was founded by Greeks from Corinth and Corfu in 588 BC. While the ruins are minimal, the onsite Apollonia Museum complex is excellent to experience. We'll return on board. Tonight's festivities will have an Albanian flair!

Description.Title: VLORE
Description.Text: Join us for a full-day tour of Apollonia and Berat (lunch included - approx. 10.5 hours long, including 4.5 hours of driving). Our first stop will be Berat. We'll then continue on to the largest archaeological site in Albania: Apollonia. Description.Title: DURRËS
Description.Text:
This morning, we’ll visit Tirana and its Natural History Museum (free excursion, approximately 5 hours long, including 2 hours of driving). Tirana, the capital and largest city, is the heart of Albania's cultural, economic, and governmental activity. We'll visit the National History Museum, which takes you chronologically from ancient Illyria to the post-communist era. We’ll also see Skanderbeg Square, where you can get a good look at the city’s oldest building, the historic Et'hem Bey Mosque (the mosque is currently closed for renovations; the initial visit to this site will be replaced by a tour of the Blloku area). Once the area where the communist elite resided, it is now an upscale location for dining, shopping, and entertainment. Blloku is also well-known for its colorful, sometimes garish facades that contrast with the gray Soviet-era buildings. The simple, three-story former residence of Enver Halil Hoxha, head of Albania for over 40 years, can still be seen on Ismail Qemali Street.
We'll spend the afternoon cruising. Join us for an evening of dinner and dancing.

Description.Title: BAR (Montenegro)
Description.Text:
We'll spend the morning on a visit to Stari Bar. Enjoy a guided tour of this old urban settlement in the mountains above the city of Bar. The tranquil feel of this place will make you fall in love with the whole country. Together with the stronghold towers, city gates, gun powder room, Prince's Palace, and Bishop's Palace, one can imagine the impressive town that it used to be.
We'll spend the afternoon cruising alongside Montenegrin coastline and through the Bay of Kotor.
Tonight is our festive gala evening.

Description.Title: LARNACA (Cyprus)
Description.Text: This morning, join us for an excursion to Nicosia. The Cypriot capital has two faces and symbolizes two contrasting cultures united by a shared history. Brimming with gems to discover, Nicosia stands as the last officially divided European city. This afternoon, enjoy some free time to discover Larnaca on your own. We'll start sailing towards Israel at the end of the day.

Description.Title: HAIFA (Israel)
Description.Text: Full-day excursion through Galilee including the Sea of Galilee (lunch included; approx. 9 hours total, including 4 hours round trip). The Sea of Galilee, a freshwater lake also known as Lake Tiberias or Kinneret in Hebrew, is the main water source in Israel and crystallizes for Christians the place where many of the events described in the Bible occurred. Our excursion will first take you to Cana (or Kafr Cana), where Jesus performed the miracle of transforming water into wine. We'll continue on to the Mount of Beatitudes, from where there are wonderful views of Lake Tiberias. This is the hill where Jesus is believed to have delivered his “Sermon on the Mount”. We'll next head for Tabgha, believed to be the most beautiful and peaceful of holy Christian sites and which was the scene of many Gospel stories, before moving on to Capernaum, the base camp for Jesus during his Galilean ministry.

Description.Title: HAIFA (Israel)

Description.Title: HAIFA (Israel)
Description.Text: Full-day excursion to Jerusalem and Bethlehem (lunch included; approx. 12 hours total, including 4 hours round trip). In Bethlehem, we’ll visit the Church of the Nativity, which contains the grotto where many Christians believe Jesus was born. We’ll continue on to Jerusalem, considered holy ground by three religions—Christianity, Judaism, and Islam. The old city contains over 200 historic sites, including the Wailing Wall and the Church of the Holy Sepulchre, which encompasses the hill where Jesus was crucified and his tomb. We will also visit the colorful market where the three main religions live side by side.

Description.Title: HAIFA (Israel)

Description.Title: HAIFA (Israel)
Description.Text: Full-day excursion including Masada and the Dead Sea (lunch included; approx. 12 hours total, incl. 5 hours round trip). Masada is one of Israel’s most popular tourist destinations. The breathtaking, strategic location is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a symbol of heroism and importance within Jewish culture. Masada was built in 30 BC by King Herod. When Israel began its great revolt against Rome in 68 AD, the site became a stronghold for Jewish rebels. The Romans besieged Masada in the year 72. Rather than be taken alive by their adversaries, the population of Masada chose to die by suicide. After our stirring visit to this important historical site, we will continue to the Dead Sea for lunch and an afternoon at the side of the pool or in the sea’s beneficial waters and muds.

Description.Title: HAIFA (Israel) - LIMASSOL (Cyprus)
Description.Text:
This morning, guided tour of Nazareth. We'll set off for our discovery tour of Nazareth, travelling through the lovely hills of Upper Galilee and the historic Jezreel Valley until we reach the spot where the Angel Gabriel told the Virgin Mary that she would give birth to the Messiah. We'll visit the Church of the Annunciation, the largest Catholic church in the Middle East and one of the holiest shrines in the Christian world. Then, we'll continue to the Greek Orthodox Church of St Gabriel, where the water from an underground spring flows through the apse and into the adjacent Mary's Well. Finally, we will visit St Joseph's Church, built in 1914 on the very spot believed to be the workshop of Joseph the carpenter.

We'll spend all afternoon sailing towards Limassol.

Description.Title: LIMASSOL - LARNACA (Cyprus)
Description.Text:
This morning, excursion to Paphos Archaeological Park. Listed by UNESCO as a World Heritage Site since 1980, this exceptional site features the Tombs of the Kings, a mysterious underground necropolis located amidst an almost deserted landscape. We'll then visit the houses of Dionysos, Theseus and Aion whose splendid mosaics were discovered by chance in 1962. A few kilometers further on, we will stop in the village of Yeroskipou to visit a small workshop where Loukoum (Cyprus Delight) is made, followed by a tasting session.

The afternoon will be spent sailing towards Larnaca.

Tonight’s our gala dinner and evening.

Description.Title: Our strengths
Description.Text: Join us for an exceptional cruise between Cyprus and Israel. You will discover the treasures of the Holy Land in Galilee but also Jerusalem, Bethlehem and Nazareth. Cyprus will amaze you with its breath-taking sceneries. Nicosia or Paphos: with the impressive mosaics of these ancient cities and contrasting capitals, embark on an extraordinary journey!

Description.Title: ATHENS
Description.Text: You’ll board our ship at 6 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we’ll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment. We’ll remain in port overnight.

Description.Title: ATHENS - HYDRA
Description.Text:
We’ll set out on our excursion to Athens and the Acropolis. We’ll explore the Acropolis, an ancient religious center in Athens that includes the Temple of Athena Nike and the Caryatid Porch of the Erechtheion. Of course, the Parthenon dedicated to the goddess Athena, whom the people of Athens considered their patron, is not to be missed. After our visit to the Acropolis, enjoy a coach tour of the capital of Greece.

We’ll spend the afternoon cruising the Saronic Gulf.

We'll remain in Hydra for the night.

Description.Title: ATHENS - HYDRA
Description.Text:
We’ll set out on our excursion to Athens and the Acropolis. We’ll explore the Acropolis, an ancient religious center in Athens that includes the Temple of Athena Nike and the Caryatid Porch of the Erechtheion. Of course, the Parthenon dedicated to the goddess Athena, whom the people of Athens considered their patron, is not to be missed. After our visit to the Acropolis, enjoy a coach tour of the capital of Greece.

We’ll spend the afternoon cruising the Saronic Gulf.

We'll remain in Hydra for the night.

Description.Title: HYDRA - Corinth Canal - CORINTH
Description.Text:
Enjoy a morning on your own in Hydra. As soon as you set foot on the shores of the island, you’ll feel like you’ve been transported back in time. Everything on the island is carried on the backs of mules, on carts, or by hand. There are no cars, but water taxis fly around the island like bees around a hive. Everything slows down to a vacation pace. Homes and manors look like they come straight out of an old film. Hydra’s long maritime history is found in each port. Canons still point to the Aegean Sea, and the homes of skippers line the harbor.

We'll spend the afternoon cruising and will pass through the famous Corinth Canal—one of the highlights of our cruise. It is 4 miles long (6.4 km) and 70 feet wide (24.6 m) at its base, making it impassable for most modern ships. At times, the height of the cliffs on the side of the canal can reach over 260 feet (79.5 m)—an amazing sight in itself. We'll remain in Corinth for the night. Enjoy an evening on the dance floor.

Description.Title: HYDRA - Corinth Canal - CORINTH

Description.Title: CORINTH
Description.Text: This morning’s excursion: Mycenae and Nafplio. We will leave by coach for Mycenae. Greek mythology states it was founded by Perseus. The earliest archaeological fragments indicate that Mycenae was inhabited in prehistoric times. Our tour includes one of the most visited spots in Mycenae: The Gate of Lions.  We’ll then head to Nafplio, the first capital of modern Greece dominated by Palamidi Fortress.  We’ll spend the afternoon cruising.

Description.Title: CORINTH
Description.Text: This morning’s excursion: Mycenae and Nafplio. We will leave by coach for Mycenae. Greek mythology states it was founded by Perseus. The earliest archaeological fragments indicate that Mycenae was inhabited in prehistoric times. Our tour includes one of the most visited spots in Mycenae: The Gate of Lions.  We’ll then head to Nafplio, the first capital of modern Greece dominated by Palamidi Fortress.  We’ll spend the afternoon cruising.

Description.Title: IGOUMENITSA
Description.Text:
One-day Excursion: The Meteora (an approximate 5-hour, round-trip drive). Join us in discovering one of the grandest sites in Greece. Our approach from Kalabaka provides the first stunning views as dozens of monasteries built along steep cliffs seem to defy gravity and the depths of our imaginations. Local legends recount how the rocks fell from the sky so that hermits could retreat there to pray. Later, the Greek Orthodox Church extended this tradition by building isolated monasteries. Even today, monks live in a few of the buildings, and we are allowed to visit them via steep staircases.

We’ll cast off for Dubrovnik. Tonight is our festive gala evening.

Our cruise includes an excursion to The Meteora, an impressive rock formation hosting a large complex of Eastern Orthodox monasteries along its cliffs.

Description.Title: LARNACA - LIMASSOL
Description.Text: You’ll board our ship at 6 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we’ll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. We’ll have dinner and enjoy traditional entertainment on board. While you sleep, our ship will begin to cruise to Limassol.

Description.Title: LARNACA - LIMASSOL
Description.Text: You’ll board our ship at 6 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we’ll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. We’ll have dinner and enjoy traditional entertainment on board. While you sleep, our ship will begin to cruise to Limassol.

Description.Title: LIMASSOL - RHODES
Description.Text:
In the morning, we’ll visit the archaeological site of Paphos, which is listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. We’ll visit the impressive, underground tombs dating back to the 4th century BC that show a distinct Egyptian influence. The remains of villas, palaces, theaters, fortresses, and tombs mean that the site is of exceptional architectural and historic value.  We’ll continue to the coastal town of Yeroskipou to visit a Loukoum (Turkish Delight) factory and enjoy a tasting.

We’ll spend the afternoon cruising. Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: LIMASSOL - RHODES
Description.Text:
In the morning, we’ll visit the archaeological site of Paphos, which is listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. We’ll visit the impressive, underground tombs dating back to the 4th century BC that show a distinct Egyptian influence. The remains of villas, palaces, theaters, fortresses, and tombs mean that the site is of exceptional architectural and historic value.  We’ll continue to the coastal town of Yeroskipou to visit a Loukoum (Turkish Delight) factory and enjoy a tasting.

We’ll spend the afternoon cruising. Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: RHODES - PAROS
Description.Text:
We’ll spend the morning cruising.

In the afternoon, we’ll visit the ancient, medieval city of Rhodes. From the port, we’ll head to Monte Smith and take in the splendid views of Rhodes and the surrounding areas from above. The d’Amboise Gate brings you into the huge fortress at the top of the city and the Palace of the Grand Master of the Knights of Rhodes, a sumptuous castle filled with priceless mosaics and statues.  Our tour will continue on the Street of the Knights: completely restored and beautifully preserved, it is lined by the buildings where holy warriors spent their time in prayer or military practice. Each building is an “inn” for each language spoken according to the knights’ birthplace: England, France, Germany, Italy, Aragon, Auvergne, or Provence. Even today you can feel the important history of the site in each stone.  What we see now, though, owes much to Italian restorations during the 1930s.

Join us for an evening of dinner and dancing. Our ship will cruise to Paros overnight.

Description.Title: RHODES - PAROS
Description.Text:
We’ll spend the morning cruising.

In the afternoon, we’ll visit the ancient, medieval city of Rhodes. From the port, we’ll head to Monte Smith and take in the splendid views of Rhodes and the surrounding areas from above. The d’Amboise Gate brings you into the huge fortress at the top of the city and the Palace of the Grand Master of the Knights of Rhodes, a sumptuous castle filled with priceless mosaics and statues.  Our tour will continue on the Street of the Knights: completely restored and beautifully preserved, it is lined by the buildings where holy warriors spent their time in prayer or military practice. Each building is an “inn” for each language spoken according to the knights’ birthplace: England, France, Germany, Italy, Aragon, Auvergne, or Provence. Even today you can feel the important history of the site in each stone.  What we see now, though, owes much to Italian restorations during the 1930s.

Join us for an evening of dinner and dancing. Our ship will cruise to Paros overnight.

Description.Title: PAROS
Description.Text:
We’ll spend the morning cruising.

The afternoon will be dedicated to a guided tour of Parikia. The port of Parikia was developed thousands of years ago around the marble trade. Today, it is a beautiful Mediterranean island with cobblestone streets, passages dating back to medieval times, and homes surrounded by bougainvillea. It is also the location of the Panagia Ekatontapiliani (the church with one hundred doors), a magnificent Byzantine structure which was slowly restored to its original beauty after an earthquake in the 18th century. Our next stop will be Lefkes, the highest village on the island that runs alongside an abandoned marble quarry. Lastly, we’ll visit Naoussa. This lovely port city looks like it was plucked right out of a postcard: colorful fishing boats bob in the waters, castle ruins sit half submerged in the sea, and sinewy streets are lined with bright white abodes.

Description.Title: PAROS
Description.Text:
We’ll spend the morning cruising.

The afternoon will be dedicated to a guided tour of Parikia. The port of Parikia was developed thousands of years ago around the marble trade. Description.Title: PAROS - MYKONOS - DELOS
Description.Text:
We’ll cruise to Mykonos in the early morning,

We’ll set off on a guided tour of the island and the city of Mykonos. Our first stop will be the Monastery of Panagia Tourliani, founded in the 16th century. We’ll then head to the city of Mykonos, a veritable labyrinth of small streets lined with traditional whitewash homes and cobblestone lanes. The city is dotted with churches and chapels, giving it an almost ethereal air. After we return on board, we’ll begin to cruise to Delos.

This afternoon, join us for an excursion to Delos (transfer to shore via launch). This archaeological site takes up most of the island and is the largest city dating back to the Antiquity on the Aegean Sea.  Greek mythology claims the island as the birthplace of twin brothers Apollo and Artemis, and it was a center for worship of the gods beginning in the 5th century BC.

Tonight is our festive gala evening. Our ship will cruise to Athens overnight.

Tonight is our festive gala evening. Our ship will cruise to Athens overnight.

Description.Title: ATHENS
Description.Text:
This morning, we’ll set out on our excursion to Athens and the Acropolis. We’ll explore the Acropolis, an ancient religious center in Athens that includes the Temple of Athena Nike and the Caryatid Porch of the Erechtheion. Of course, the Parthenon dedicated to the goddess Athena, whom the people of Athens considered their patron, is not to be missed. After our visit to the Acropolis, enjoy a coach tour of the capital of Greece.

The afternoon can be spent on an excursion to the Apollo Coast and Cape Sounion. We’ll take the route that travels along the Saronic Gulf, which brings us to Cape Sounion. The temple of Poseidon dominates the southernmost tip of Attica, where the horizon meets the Aegean Sea. The ancient Greek temple is one of the major monuments from the Golden Age of Greece. This evening, we’ll enjoy an onboard Greek-themed soirée.

The archaeological sites in Paphos, legendary sites in Athens—including the Acropolis—medieval ruins in Mykonos and Rhodes, and the deep history oozing from every stone in Cyprus and Greece in one splendid voyage.

CRUISE HIGHLIGHTS

    • Rhodes, the city of Knights
    • Paros and its many faces
    • Mykonos, stunning blues and whites of the Cyclades
    • The sacred island of Delos
    • Athens and the Acropolis
    • Cape Sounion and the Apollo Coast
  • Onboard Greek festivities and soirée

Description.Title: ABU DHABI (United Arab Emirates)
Description.Text:
Your program will begin according to your time of arrival in Abu Dhabi:

Passengers are welcome to board beginning at 10:00 a.m. Our crew will welcome you and help you get comfortably settled into your cabins. Enjoy lunch on board. Abu Dhabi, known for generations as the “Father of the Gazelle,” sprang from the sands on the shores of the Persian Gulf. This ever-changing city is able to continue expanding thanks to the construction of monumental, human-made islands. Between the skyscrapers, large avenues, and cozy homes, Abu Dhabi’s cityscape is sure to captivate visitors.

EXCURSION: Panoramic tour of Abu Dhabi (in the afternoon)

We’ll discover this unique city while driving along the beautiful panoramic route from the Corniche all the way to the viewpoint of Breakwater Island. We’ll stop for a photo op at one of the most impressive hotels and conference centers ever constructed: the magnificent Emirates Palace.

We’ll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail, have dinner, and spend the night on board.

Description.Title: ABU DHABI (United Arab Emirates)
Description.Text:
Your program will begin according to your time of arrival in Abu Dhabi:

Passengers are welcome to board beginning at 10:00 a.m. Our crew will welcome you and help you get comfortably settled into your cabins. Enjoy lunch on board.

EXCURSION: Panoramic tour of Abu Dhabi (in the afternoon). We’ll discover this unique city while driving along a beautiful panoramic route. We’ll stop for a photo op at the Emirates Palace.

We’ll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail, have dinner, and spend the night on board.

Description.Title: ABU DHABI
Description.Text:
EXCURSION: The Louvre Abu Dhabi museum (in the morning)

The recently opened Louvre Abu Dhabi museum is an architectural landmark in itself. Built on an island between the sea and the sand, the museum’s dimensions are colossal and include 260,000 square feet of exhibits (24,000 m2). It was conceived to be a place where dialog between civilizations, cultures, and religions can be cultivated and promoted. It is the top universal museum in the Arab world and was conceived and designed by French architect Jean Nouvel. After our tour, we'll return to the port by way of the Al Bateen district.

We’ll enjoy lunch on board.

EXCURSION: The Presidential Palace and the Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque (in the afternoon)

Join us for a visit to the Presidential Palace (Qasr Al Watan, or “Palace of the Nation”), which recently opened its doors to the public at the initiative of the Emir of Abu Dhabi, thus allowing visitors to discover the traditions and values of his country. The palace houses a library containing 50,000 works and exhibit rooms where the many gifts offered to the country are put on display. We’ll also stroll through the gardens of this majestic palace. Next, we’ll visit the Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque (named after the immensely revered “Father of the Nation”), a veritable work of art with its 10,000 columns, chandeliers plated in 24-karat gold, and the capacity to hold 40,000 people.

We’ll have dinner and spend the night on board. We’ll spend the night cruising to Dubai.

Description.Title: ABU DHABI
Description.Text:
EXCURSION: The Louvre Abu Dhabi museum (in the morning), the top universal museum in the Arab world, conceived and designed by French architect Jean Nouvel. After our tour, we'll return to the port by way of the Al Bateen district.

We’ll enjoy lunch on board.

EXCURSION: The Presidential Palace and the Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque (in the afternoon). Join us for a visit to the Presidential Palace (Qasr Al Watan). We’ll also stroll through the gardens of this majestic palace and visit the Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque.

We’ll have dinner and spend the night on board. We’ll spend the night cruising to Dubai.

Description.Title: DUBAI (United Arab Emirates)
Description.Text:
A small pearl-fishing village 150 years ago, Dubai’s exponential growth started in the early 2000s when the government decided to make it the world’s top tourist destination. Pharaonic projects were undertaken with the construction of Palm Island and the ever-higher, ever-more-luxurious towers, including the Burj Khalifa. From that point on, it was a race to the extreme. Dubai is the trendiest city of the decade.

EXCURSION: The Burj Khalifa Tower and Palm Island (in the morning)

We’ll embark on an excursion that is ahead of its time, where the limitless creative spirit and imagination of humankind raised the highest tower in the world out of the sand and sea on stunning Palm Island. This island is built to resemble the outline of a palm tree. It was created from scratch and is home to many splendid villas and sumptuous hotel complexes. Next, well ascend to the top of the Burj Khalifa, the highest human-made structure ever built (2,716.5 feet/828 meters). You’ll enjoy a breathtaking, panoramic view of the Persian Gulf from its observation deck.

EXCURSION: Take a tour of Dubai (in the afternoon)

Here, you can let your wildest dreams take flight while walking in the footsteps of the past. We’ll visit the city’s oldest building: the Al Fahidi Fort, built in 1787 and later converted into a museum. You’ll discover the traditional, urban, and rural lifestyles in the Emirate of Dubai. It is a veritable kaleidoscope, giving you a glimpse of the many facets of the country over the past centuries. Next, we’ll stroll through traditional markets, or “souks,” selling everything from aromatic spices to gold. The lively atmosphere of the souk is the perfect setting to discover and interact with the local population.

We’ll have dinner and spend the night on board. We’ll spend the night cruising to Khasab.

Description.Title: DUBAI (United Arab Emirates)
Description.Text:
EXCURSION: The Burj Khalifa Tower and Palm Island (in the morning). We’ll embark on an excursion to stunning Palm Island and then ascend to the top of the Burj Khalifa, the highest human-made structure ever built.

EXCURSION: Take a tour of Dubai (in the afternoon). We’ll visit the city’s oldest building: the Al Fahidi Fort. Now converted into a museum, it showcases the traditional, urban, and rural lifestyles in the Emirate of Dubai. Next, we’ll stroll through traditional markets.

We’ll have dinner and spend the night on board. We’ll spend the night cruising to Khasab.

Description.Title: KHASAB (Sultanate of Oman)
Description.Text:
Deep in the craggy fjords, Khasab occupies a strategic position in the Strait of Ormuz. The Musandam Peninsula is an enclave of the Sultanate of Oman on the lands of the United Arab Emirates. Isolated and preserved, this village—where everyone knows everyone—is dominated by its fort that seems to stand guard between the Persian Gulf and the Gulf of Oman. The “Norway of Arabia” attracts visitors for the surreal beauty of its landscape and for its marine life: dolphins, stingrays, and turtles, to name but a few.

EXCURSION: Khasab and the surrounding area (in the morning)(1)

Join us for a visit to Khasab Fort, built by the Portuguese in the 17th century to protect their trading activities in the highly-coveted area. We’ll continue our discovery as we navigate along the coastal route to Bukha. We’ll stop in the small, traditional village of Mukhi, known for its old, cubic houses clinging to the steep mountain. This craggy region offers visitors spectacular views of the landscape.

OR

EXCURSION: Cruise on a dhow (in the morning)(1)

Climb aboard a dhow, the ancestral sailing vessel of this region, used in centuries past to transport merchandise, passengers, and even slaves. Today, these elegant wooden ships with triangular sails navigate the fjords of the Musandam Peninsula. On turquoise waters, the dhow sails in search of the most beautiful landscapes and the steepest, most stunning cliffs. You can enjoy a swim in one of the inlets where the waters are calm and refreshing.

The afternoon will be spent cruising to Muscat. We’ll have dinner and spend the night on board.

Description.Title: KHASAB (Sultanate of Oman)
Description.Text:
EXCURSION: Khasab and the surrounding area (in the morning)(1). Join us for a visit to Khasab Fort before stopping in the small, traditional village of Mukhi.

OR

EXCURSION: Cruise on a dhow (in the morning)(1). Climb aboard a dhow, the ancestral sailing vessel of this region. You can enjoy a swim in one of the inlets.

The afternoon will be spent cruising to Muscat. We’ll have dinner and spend the night on board.

Description.Title: MUSCAT (Sultanate of Oman)
Description.Text:
We’ll spend the morning cruising to Muscat. Between 9,800-foot high mountains (3,000 meters) and the shores of the Gulf of Oman, Muscat has continued to expand along the coast over the years. It is one of the oldest cities in the Middle East. Contrary to its neighbors, there are no flamboyant skyscrapers here to block the view—only cozy small buildings, historic monuments, defensive forts, and a sumptuous, monumental mosque. Muscat seduces visitors with its authentic cachet and its hospitable locals.

We’ll enjoy lunch on board.

EXCURSION: Take a tour of Muscat (in the afternoon)

We’ll take the coastal route, winding under the watchful eye of the Al Jalali, Al Mirani, and Muttrah forts. We’ll stop for a photo op at the very camera-friendly Al Alam Palace, ceremonial residence of Sultan Qaboos of Oman. We’ll continue our city tour with a visit to the Royal Opera House Muscat, inaugurated in 2011 and able to seat 1,100 spectators, and the new, colossal parliament building. Enjoy some time on your own by discovering the souk of Muttrah. In this maze of narrow streets and alleyways stretching along the Corniche, the stalls offer a variety of goods: spices, souvenirs, trinkets, gold jewelry, and much more.

We’ll have dinner and spend the night on board.

Description.Title: MUSCAT (Sultanate of Oman)
Description.Text:
We’ll spend the morning cruising to Muscat. We’ll enjoy lunch on board.

EXCURSION: Take a tour of Muscat (in the afternoon). We’ll stop for a photo op at the Al Alam Palace, ceremonial residence of Sultan Qaboos of Oman. We’ll continue our city tour with a visit to the Royal Opera House Muscat. Enjoy some time on your own by discovering the souk of Muttrah.

We’ll have dinner and spend the night on board.

Description.Title: MUSCAT
Description.Text:
EXCURSION: Nizwa, along the route of Oman’s fortresses (full-day excursion)

Well before Muscat, Nizwa was the country’s capital city. Located in the heart of a mountainous region, at the crossroads of old caravan routes, Nizwa is a veritable oasis. You’ll enjoy sumptuous panoramic views from the wall-walk of its magnificent fortress. The nearby souk will give you an opportunity to purchase a few souvenirs. Enjoy lunch. We’ll cross a region with high mountains and terrace cultivation (the Jebel Akhdar). Enjoy a leisurely stroll through the village of Al Hamra, where the past is still alive. The small houses made of mud, pebbles, and palm beams have an irresistible charm and are in the process of being restored. You’ll visit a typical home and meet with the local population for coffee and a bite of a few dates.

We’ll have dinner and spend the night on board. We’ll spend the night cruising to Sur.

Description.Title: MUSCAT
Description.Text:
EXCURSION: Nizwa, along the route of Oman’s fortresses (full-day excursion). Located in the heart of a mountainous region, Nizwa is a veritable oasis. You’ll visit its magnificent fortress and the nearby souk. After lunch, we’ll cross a region with high mountains and terrace cultivation (the Jebel Akhdar). Enjoy a leisurely stroll through the village of Al Hamra, where you’ll visit a typical home.

We’ll have dinner and spend the night on board. We’ll spend the night cruising to Sur.

Description.Title: SUR (Sultanate of Oman)
Description.Text:
Off the beaten path of the usual tourist circuits, Sur is the gateway to the Wahiba Sands. Sur's natural, remarkable setting includes a large bay, immaculately white seaside houses with sculpted wooden balconies, and dhow construction workshops. The city is unique and surprising because it seems to have been frozen in time for several decades.

EXCURSION: From a desert to the wadi (full-day excursion)

Our four-wheel-drive vehicles will take you on an exciting excursion to discover a rare curiosity: the wadis—vast, natural stretches of water shaded by palm, date, and mango trees. Enjoy a refreshing swim in the crystal-clear, fresh water of the Wadi Bani Khaled. It’s like heaven on earth. We’ll head to the Wahiba Sands desert. The contrast is striking. The route becomes straight and linear, a few dromedaries wander onto the asphalt, and the sand whirlwinds with the passage of each car. Soon, we’ll arrive on the stretches of golden sand. We’ll enjoy lunch in one of the desert camps. The expedition continues on the sand tracks, at the foot of the rippling dunes—some of which measure as high as three hundred feet. At the end of the day, the spectacle is breathtaking when the crests of the dunes shimmer with iridescence in the sunlight.

We’ll have dinner and spend the night on board. We’ll spend the night cruising to Muscat.

Description.Title: SUR (Sultanate of Oman)
Description.Text:
Off the beaten path of the usual tourist circuits, Sur is the gateway to the Wahiba Sands.

EXCURSION: From a desert to the wadi (full-day excursion). Our four-wheel-drive vehicles will take you on an exciting excursion to discover the wadis—vast, natural stretches of water. We’ll head to the Wahiba Sands desert and enjoy lunch in one of the desert camps. The expedition continues on the sand tracks, at the foot of the rippling dunes.

We’ll have dinner and spend the night on board. We’ll spend the night cruising to Muscat.

Description.Title: MUSCAT
Description.Text:
EXCURSION: A typical day in Muscat (in the morning)

Early in the morning, things are already bustling at the Muttrah Fish Market. Chiseled-faced fishermen negotiate the price for their daily catch. After, we’ll visit the Sultan Qaboos Grand Mosque. Inaugurated in 2001, it can welcome up to 20,000 worshipers. A veritable work of art in itself, the mosque radiates throughout the entire city. The jewel in its crown is a monumental Persian prayer carpet measuring about 45,000 square feet (4,263 m2). This handmade masterpiece took four years to complete and weighs 21 tons. Join us for a visit to the Bait Al Zubair private museum, housed in a stately white residence built in the typical Omani architectural style. This ethnographic museum is home to one of the most beautiful collections demonstrating the lifestyle of the family of Sheikh Al Zubair: sabers, firearms, traditional women’s costumes, jewels, musical instruments, objects used in daily life, and more.

We’ll enjoy lunch on board.

EXCURSION: Coastal cruise on a dhow (in the afternoon)

Climb aboard a dhow—a traditional sailing vessel and the pride of Omani mariners. Made of wood, the dhow was used to travel from region to region and from country to country. Today, dhows are a visitor’s delight, allowing them to admire the rocky coastline and long sandy beaches against the backdrop of the high mountains.

We’ll have dinner and spend the night on board.

Description.Title: MUSCAT
Description.Text:
EXCURSION: A typical day in Muscat (in the morning). We’ll visit the Sultan Qaboos Grand Mosque and the Bait Al Zubair private museum.

We’ll enjoy lunch on board.

EXCURSION: Coastal cruise on a dhow (in the afternoon), a traditional sailing vessel and the pride of Omani mariners.

We’ll have dinner and spend the night on board.

Description.Text: Enjoy one last breakfast on board before disembarking. End of our services.

Description.Title: MUSCAT
Description.Text: Enjoy one last breakfast on board before disembarking. End of our services.
Desert Cruise from Abu Dhabi to Muscat

Description.Title: Our strengths
Description.Text: Join us on the Desert Cruise and plunge into the fascinating and little-known history of the United Arab Emirates and the Sultanate of Oman. The Arabian Peninsula has always been an inevitable port of call on the sea route to India. Over the past 30 years, the skyscrapers of the United Arab Emirates have sprung from the desert sands to mingle with the clouds. Despite this flourishing growth, the country has carefully preserved its culture by way of its rural past mixing with ultra-modern large cities. The Sultanate of Oman cultivates its authenticity by distinguishing itself from its neighbors: grandiose landscapes, high mountains, and long stretches of sand, desert, and wadis. Visitors are fascinated by the multiple facets of Oman’s countryside, history, and culture. Welcome to the country where mirages become reality.

Description.Title: Highlights
Description.Text:
CRUISE HIGHLIGHTS

  • Cruise on a dhow, a traditional Arab sailing vessel, to the heart of the Musandam Peninsula fjords
  • EXCURSIONS INCLUDED:
    • Visit the Louvre Abu Dhabi, the top universal museum in the Arab world
    • In Dubai, ascend to the top of the Burj Khalifa, the highest tower in the world at 2,716.5 feet (828 meters)
    • Revisit history in the Sultanate of Oman by following the route of Oman’s fortresses
    • Meet and chat with an Omani family in the village of Al Hamra
    • Take a refreshing swim in Wadi Bani Khaled
    • Enjoy an exciting, four-wheel-drive excursion through the Wahiba Sands desert

Description.Title: Formalities
Description.Text:
United Arab Emirates: For French, Belgian, Swiss, and Canadian nationals: a valid passport is sufficient to enter the territory of the United Arab Emirates (no visa necessary). The passport must be valid at least 6 months beyond the date of your entry into the Emirati territory.

Oman: For French, Belgian, Swiss and Canadian nationals: passport that is valid for 6 months after your date of return and mandatory Omani e-visa.

The average delay for an Omani visa, if you apply directly to the embassy yourself using the website https://evisa.rop.gov.om/, is approximately twenty working days. CroisiEurope can take care of the paperwork and make the request for you for a fee, and in this case, the application would need to be processed 30 days before your departure date.

For other nationalities: please consult the competent authorities (consulate/embassy) before your trip.

Description.Title: Additional information
Description.Text:
INTERNET

SATELLITE CONNECTIONS

Our ship provides Internet connection via satellite while we cruise, which is different and slower than what we are used to through our regular home or office services. We cannot guarantee connection at all times. Please keep this in mind while you are enjoying your vacation with us.

TELEPHONE SERVICE

DURING CRUISE

When we are at sea, you can connect your device(s) to the onboard GSM/3G network. Your service provider will automatically send you the terms and conditions of use for this service. You will be able to make calls, send messages, or use the Internet through this network’s roaming services. The GSM network will be turned off once the ship enters a port.

WHILE IN PORT

When the ship is in a port, you will be able to receive and make calls via your international calling/service plan according to the country you are visiting.

WATCH OUT FOR SERVICE FEES

We strongly recommend that you contact your service provider before your departure; international calls and data usage can be very costly and are almost never included in basic operator packages.

PLEASE CHECK THE SETTINGS FOR YOUR DEVICE

Once you are on board, but before you connect to the Internet, please check the settings for your device(s).  We request that you limit the downloading of videos and large-volume files. Automatic updates to your PC, tablet, and smartphones will affect the speed and cost of your connection. You probably have automatic updates for apps on your devices that you are not aware of. We recommend that you deactivate these updates while you are staying with us.

Description.Title: Useful information
Description.Text:
EXCURSIONS:

  • Excursions are only available for purchase up to 15 days before your trip begins. Certain excursions are programmed at the same time and cannot be combined.
  • Excursions will alternate between air-conditioned buses and small local boats.
  • The excursions will be narrated by a local tour guide, and you will have earphones for easier listening.

PRECAUTIONS

Vaccines are not mandatory for this trip. It is nevertheless advisable to be up to date with the following vaccinations: tetanus, polio, hepatitis A and B, diphtheria, and typhoid fever. The use of mosquito repellent is highly recommended.

CURRENCY EXCHANGE

  • For the current exchange rates for the Emirati dirham and Omani rial, please consult websites such as www.xe.com or www.onada.com/currency/converter.
  • You will be able to find currency exchange offices and automatic teller machines easily.
  • There is no currency exchange service on board.

WEATHER

In terms of weather, the most pleasant period for visiting the United Arab Emirates and the Sultanate of Oman is between November and February. This will allow you to avoid seasons of heavy rain or unbearable heat. Temperatures range between 64°F (18°C) in the morning and 82°F (28°C) in the afternoon. It can be chilly in the Omani mountains. The temperature of the sea is around 75°F (24°C).

TIME DIFFERENCE

You can consult www.worldtimezone.com to see the time difference between your home and your destination.

Description.Title: Mentions
Description.Text:
These cruises and tours are not recommended for persons with reduced mobility. You must be in good physical condition to participate. Certain visits are done on foot.

  • The captain of the ship is the sole authority who can modify the ship itinerary for safety or navigational reasons.
  • The excursions may be modified or their order changed due to technical requirements, cultural events, etc. In addition, local authorities may decide to close certain sites or museums without prior notice. If this happens, we will propose an alternative.
  • We recommend travelers wear long skirts/dresses/pants and long sleeves when visiting monuments in these countries. Women will need to cover their hair when visiting certain sites.

(1) These excursions are programmed at the same time and cannot be combined.

Alcohol can be dangerous to your health. Please drink in moderation.

Valid information for year 2020

  • 30% discount for 1 child between 2 and 9 years old sharing a cabin with 2 adults (on the price of the cruise only - excluding supplements and service fees)

Description.Text: Passengers are welcome to board at 6:00 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we’ll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. We’ll enjoy dinner on board this evening. The rest of the evening is yours to do as you please.

Description.Title: AQABA
Description.Text: Passengers are welcome to board at 6:00 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we’ll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. We’ll enjoy dinner on board this evening. The rest of the evening is yours to do as you please.

Description.Title: AQABA
Description.Text:
Join us for a full-day excursion to Petra (lunch included; approx. 10 hours total, incl. 4 hours round trip). Petra is unquestionably one of the greatest marvels ever erected by Man and Nature and is considered to be one of Jordan’s national treasures. Carved into the pink and red stone by the Nabataeans—an Arab people living in Jordan over 2000 years ago—Petra, meaning “rock” in Greek, was strategically located at the junction of the silk and spice trade routes. To enter the city, we will follow the “siq”, a narrow gorge approximately one kilometer in length, delimited by sharp cliffs on either side—ending at Al Khazneh, the “Treasury”: The tomb of a Nabataean, this impressive Hellenistic facade was carved directly into the pink stone at the beginning of the 1st century. It is a masterpiece of refinement and symmetry which, on its own, makes a visit to Petra worthwhile. You will also discover the Roman style Nabataean theater carved into the rock over 2000 years ago.

Enjoy an evening of entertainment on board.

Description.Title: AQABA
Description.Text:
Join us for a full-day excursion to Petra (lunch included). Petra is unquestionably one of the greatest marvels ever erected by Man and Nature and is considered to be one of Jordan’s national treasures. You will discover the Roman style Nabataean theater carved into the rock over 2000 years ago.

Enjoy an evening of entertainment on board.

Description.Title: AQABA
Description.Text:
Join us for a full-day excursion in the Wadi Rum desert (lunch included). Alongside Petra, it is one of Jordan’s must-see sites. We’ll stop for many photo ops as we make our way by Jeep, allowing you to discover the desert made famous by Lawrence of Arabia. You’ll be dazzled by the spectacular colors of the desert, seeing them change according to the radiance of the sunlight as the day progresses. The Bedouins that inhabit the Wadi Rum are well known for their hospitality: Under their tent, you’ll be invited to enjoy tea and luscious goodies, specialties of their local cuisine.

Our ship will cruise to Hurghada overnight.

Description.Title: AQABA
Description.Text:
Join us for a full-day excursion in the Wadi Rum desert (lunch included). We’ll stop for many photo ops as we make our way by Jeep, allowing you to discover the desert made famous by Lawrence of Arabia.

Our ship will cruise to Hurghada overnight.

Description.Title: HURGHADA
Description.Text: We’ll leave for a full-day excursion to Thebes, the ancient capital of the Pharaohs: You’ll discover Luxor and the Valley of the Kings (lunch included - driving time is approximately 7 hours round trip). The Valley of the Kings is one of ancient Egypt’s top tourist destinations. Located in a deep valley just 2 km from the edge of the plain, the site contains over sixty tombs. Only the openings dotting the face of the cliff remain as tell-tale signs of the tombs below. This valley is one of the main complexes of the Ancient Theban Necropolis, located on the left bank of the Nile, directly across from the city of Luxor. It was here, in this setting, that the Pharaohs awaited immortality in their sarcophagi. Further along, dominating the eastern bank, the 18-meter-high Colossi of Memnon—faceless effigies sitting on a throne—are the ruins of the mortuary temple of Amenhotep III. Our afternoon will be spent visiting the Karnak Temple Complex. Connected to Luxor by a corridor of ram-headed sphinxes, this grandiose site dedicated to the god Amun, was continuously expanded for 1500 years. At the heart of this site stands the colossal Precinct of Amun-Re, enclosing a sacred lake that was used by priests in a purification ceremony before performing rituals in the temple. An important place of worship, it contains the Great Hypostyle Hall, a spectacular forest of gigantic columns. This historically significant complex is breathtakingly beautiful.

Description.Title: HURGHADA
Description.Text: We’ll leave for a full-day excursion to Thebes, the ancient capital of the Pharaohs: You’ll discover Luxor and the Valley of the Kings (lunch included). Located in a deep valley just 2 km from the edge of the plain, the site contains over sixty tombs. Our afternoon will be spent visiting the Karnak Temple Complex, connected to Luxor by a corridor of ram-headed sphinxes.

Description.Title: Day at sea
Description.Text: Take advantage of the wide range of onboard activities proposed during our full-day cruise today.

Description.Title: Day at sea
Description.Text: Take advantage of the wide range of onboard activities proposed during our full-day cruise today.

Description.Title: SUEZ
Description.Text: Join us for an excursion to Cairo, “walking in the footsteps of the Pharaohs” (lunch included; approx. 10 hours total, incl. 4 hours round trip). The Giza pyramid complex is home to one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World: the “Great Pyramid of Giza” (137m) whose peak is still covered in the original white "casing stones” made of highly polished white limestone, its neighbors, the Pyramid of Khafra and the Pyramid of Menkaure (exterior views only). Not far from this jewel of symmetry, the Sphinx stands guard, arousing the admiration of passersby. Abou al-Hôl, literally the “Father of Terror” in Arabic, was called Sphinx by the Greeks because he resembled the mythical winged monster, who, according to legend, guarded the Greek city of Thebes, asking a riddle to travelers seeking entry into the city, and killing those who were unable to answer. It is thought to represent the Pharaoh Khafra. We’ll then continue on to visit the Museum of Egyptian Antiquities in Cairo, one of the highlights of the day—housing, among other things, the Treasure of Tutankhamun.

Description.Title: SUEZ
Description.Text: Join us for an excursion to Cairo, “walking in the footsteps of the Pharaohs” (lunch included). The Giza pyramid complex is home to one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World: the “Great Pyramid of Giza”, its neighbors, the Pyramid of Khafra and the Pyramid of Menkaure (exterior views only). We’ll continue on to visit the Museum of Egyptian Antiquities in Cairo, housing, among other things, the Treasure of Tutankhamun.

Description.Title: SUEZ
Description.Text: Our ship will cast off to cross the Suez canal. Measuring 173 km long and only 190 meters wide, this canal allows for the strategic passage from the Mediterranean Sea to the Red Sea, without having to make the long journey around the southern tip of Africa. These incredible structures were achieved between 1859 and 1869, under the guidance of Ferdinand de Lesseps, well after Darius, the Persian conqueror of Egypt, had completed an initial version of the canal. We’ll continue cruising on the Mediterranean to Ashdod.

Description.Title: SUEZ
Description.Text: Our ship will cast off to cross the Suez canal. Measuring 173 km long and only 190 meters wide, this canal allows for the strategic passage from the Mediterranean Sea to the Red Sea, without having to make the long journey around the southern tip of Africa. We’ll continue cruising on the Mediterranean to Ashdod.

Description.Title: ASHDOD(2)
Description.Text: Join us for a full-day excursion to Jerusalem (lunch included; approx. 10 hours total, incl. 4 hours round trip). Jerusalem is one of the holiest and most fascinating cities in the world. The old city is home to over 200 historical monuments, including the Wailing Wall and the Church of the Holy Sepulchre. During this tour, we will discover the Mount of Olives, the Garden of Gethsemane, Mount Zion, as well as the colorful market where the three main religions—Christianity, Judaism, and Islam—live side by side.

Description.Title: ASHDOD(2)
Description.Text: Join us for a full-day excursion to Jerusalem (lunch included). During this tour, we will discover the Mount of Olives, the Garden of Gethsemane, Mount Zion, as well as the colorful market where the three main religions—Christianity, Judaism, and Islam—live side by side.

Description.Title: HAIFA
Description.Text:
In the morning, join us for an excursion to Galilee. Famous for its luscious landscapes dotted with rolling hills and valleys, its small picturesque cities and its historic sites, Galilee is the best kept secret in Israel.

This afternoon, we'll set off on a visit to Acre (Saint John of Acre), headquarters of the Knights Hospitaller during Crusades in the Holy Land. The old city of Acre, a UNESCO world heritage site, is home to many remarkable sites, such as ruins from the Greco-Roman period as well as from the time of the Crusades and the Ottoman Empire. Its fascinating historical heritage where East meets West and the unique ruins of the different cultures make it one of the most important cities of the ancient world.

We’ll return on board and continue cruising to Larnaca. Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: HAIFA

Automatic updates to your PC, tablet, and smartphones will affect the speed and cost of your connection. You probably have automatic updates for apps on your devices that you are not aware of. We recommend that you deactivate these updates while you are staying with us.
