Description.Text: Image slider

Description.Title: MADRAS (Chennai)
Description.Text:
Your program will begin according to your time of arrival in Madras:

Passengers are welcome to board at 8:00 a.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, enjoy free time on board before lunch. In the 18th century, Madras was just a modest fishing village sheltering a monumental fort built by English colonists on the coasts of the Bay of Bengal. It is the capital city of the State of Tamil Nadu, renowned for its wealth and its religious architecture.

EXCURSION: Take a tour of Madras (in the afternoon)

Visit the Saint Thomas cathedral, built in the 16th century by the Portuguese and rebuilt in 1896 in the Neo-Gothic style. It is believed to house the tomb of Saint Thomas, the apostle who first brought Christianity to India. Then, enter the impressive Kapaleeshwarar Temple, dedicated to Shiva. It presents an architectural style typical of this region of Tamil Nadu.

We’ll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail before dinner. We’ll spend the night on board.

Description.Title: MADRAS (Chennai)
Description.Text:
Your program will begin according to your time of arrival in Madras:

Passengers are welcome to board at 8:00 a.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, enjoy free time on board before lunch.

EXCURSION: Take a tour of Madras (in the afternoon). Visit the Saint Thomas cathedral, before entering the impressive Kapaleeshwarar Temple, dedicated to Shiva.

We’ll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail before dinner. We’ll spend the night on board.

Description.Title: MADRAS (Chennai)
Description.Text:
EXCURSION: Sanctums and forts (in the morning)

Discover the superb archaeological site of Mahabalipuram, added to the UNESCO list of world heritage sites in 1984. Away from the hustle and bustle of Madras, a group of sanctums are sculpted directly into the bedrock, the most impressive being the “Shore Temple” and the “Descent of the Ganges”.

We’ll enjoy lunch on board. We’ll cruise to Trincomalee. We’ll have dinner and spend the night on board.

Description.Title: MADRAS (Chennai)
Description.Text:
EXCURSION: Sanctums and forts (in the morning). Discover the superb archaeological site of Mahabalipuram, added to the UNESCO list of world heritage sites.

We’ll enjoy lunch on board. We’ll cruise to Trincomalee. We’ll have dinner and spend the night on board.

Description.Title: TRINCOMALEE (Sri Lanka)
Description.Text:
An important port on the eastern coast of Sri Lanka, Trincomalee has always had a major role in the history of international maritime commerce. Built on a rocky peninsula, the city embraces the vast Kottiyar bay.

EXCURSION: Take a tour of Trincomalee (in the afternoon)

Discovery the city of Trincomalee, the main center of Tamil culture.  Tour the Koneswaram temple, the temple of the thousand pillars. This Hindu temple is the most revered of the island and the main divinity is Shiva. Stroll in the local market and discover unknown, exotic fruits and vegetables.

We’ll cruise to Colombo, then have dinner and spend the night on board.

Description.Title: TRINCOMALEE (Sri Lanka)
Description.Text:
EXCURSION: Take a tour of Trincomalee (in the afternoon). Discovery the city of Trincomalee, tour the Koneswaram temple, and stroll in the local market.

We’ll cruise to Colombo, then have dinner and spend the night on board.

Description.Title: Day at sea
Description.Text: Take advantage of this day at sea to enjoy easy living aboard the Belle des Océans and take part in the proposed on-board activities.

Description.Title: Day at sea
Description.Text: Take advantage of this day at sea to enjoy easy living aboard the Belle des Océans and take part in the proposed on-board activities.

Description.Title: COLOMBO (Sri Lanka)
Description.Text:
Economic capital of the country, Colombo was known to Arab, Persian, and Chinese merchants as early as the 8th century. A small village nestled between two dunes at the time, the city became an important trading post on the spice route.

EXCURSION: The city of Galle and its fortifications, and panoramic tour of Colombo (full day) 

The city of Galle was built by the Europeans in the 16th century and was included on UNESCO’s list of world heritage sites in 1988. The most beautiful example of south-east Asian fortified cities, the entire city charmingly illustrates the rich history of the past centuries. Its granite fort and fortifications seem to protect the narrow streets lined with the beautifully colorful homes of the former Dutch merchants who came to work in spice trade. Afterwards, join us for a panoramic tour of the city of Colombo.

We’ll cruise to Kochi, then have dinner and spend the night on board.

Description.Title: COLOMBO (Sri Lanka)
Description.Text:
EXCURSION: The city of Galle and its fortifications, and panoramic tour of Colombo (full day). The city of Galle, included on UNESCO’s list of world heritage sites, is the most beautiful example of south-east Asian fortified cities. Afterwards, join us for a panoramic tour of the city of Colombo.

We’ll cruise to Kochi, then have dinner and spend the night on board.

Description.Title: Day at sea
Description.Text: Take advantage of this day at sea to enjoy easy living aboard the Belle des Océans and take part in the proposed on-board activities.

Description.Title: Day at sea
Description.Text: Take advantage of this day at sea to enjoy easy living aboard the Belle des Océans and take part in the proposed on-board activities.

Description.Title: KOCHI
Description.Text:
Kochi, located in the State of Kerala, will charm you with its rich colonial past. Occupied successively by the Portuguese, the English, the Dutch, and the French, its narrow streets and alleyways have an entirely European atmosphere. Its vast lagoon stretching along the Malabar coast is its main tourist attraction.

EXCURSION: Tour of the city of Kochi and the Backwaters of Kerala (full day)

On the way to the lagoon, enjoy a panoramic tour of the city of Kochi. Visit St. Francis Church that was once home of the tomb of Vasco da Gama. Photo op at the famous fishing ports known to be especially picturesque, then continue on towards this labyrinth of waterways, lakes, and lagoons called Backwaters. We’ll board elegant, thatch-roofed wooden boats and enjoy a lunch consisting of local specialties. We’ll then go deeper into a web of intermingled canals lined with colorful houses. Laughing children bring life to the riverbanks, while their mothers wash clothing by hand in the waters. Between luxurious vegetation, rice fields, and coconut trees, the fishermen bustle to pull in their nets.

We’ll have dinner and spend the night on board. We’ll cruise to Goa.

Description.Title: KOCHI
Description.Text:
EXCURSION: Tour of the city of Kochi and the Backwaters of Kerala (full day). Enjoy a panoramic tour of the city, visit St. Francis Church, then continue on towards Backwaters. We’ll board elegant, thatch-roofed wooden boats and enjoy a lunch consisting of local specialties.

We’ll have dinner and spend the night on board. We’ll cruise to Goa.

Description.Title: Day at sea
Description.Text: Take advantage of this day at sea to enjoy easy living aboard the Belle des Océans and take part in the proposed on-board activities.

Description.Title: Day at sea
Description.Text: Take advantage of this day at sea to enjoy easy living aboard the Belle des Océans and take part in the proposed on-board activities.

Description.Title: GOA
Description.Text:
The former capital of Portuguese India, Goa was a center for evangelicalism in India and Asia in the 16th century. Goa’s churches and convents are listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. In addition to its many historical attractions, Goa is renowned for its endless beaches and its relaxed atmosphere.

EXCURSION: Tour of the city of Goa (in the morning)

Tour one of the most attractive cities of the country: Old Goa. The Basilica of Bom Jesus is famous throughout the Catholic world because it contains the relics of Saint Francis Xavier, a Jesuit missionary charged with evangelizing the country. Then, discover one of the most fascinating buildings of the city: the convent and church of St. Francis of Assisi. Contemplate its ancient murals, its gilded wooden sculptures and its baroque altarpiece.

We’ll enjoy lunch on board. In the afternoon we’ll cruise to Bombay. We’ll have dinner and spend the night on board.

Description.Title: GOA
Description.Text:
EXCURSION: Tour of the city of Goa (in the morning). Tour of the city and discover one of the most fascinating buildings of the city: the convent and church of St. Francis of Assisi.

We’ll enjoy lunch on board. In the afternoon we’ll cruise to Bombay. We’ll have dinner and spend the night on board.

Description.Title: BOMBAY (Mumbai)
Description.Text:
The most populated city of India, Bombay is the economic capital of the country. In the last century, authorities modernized the city, which resulted in it being added to UNESCO’s list for its Neo-Gothic Victorian and Art-Deco ensembles. Both pulsating and dynamic, it reveals all of its contrasts: affluent young people walk through shanty towns while rickshaws weave between luxury cars.

EXCURSION: Take a panoramic tour of Bombay (in the afternoon)

You’ll discover the neighborhood of Colaba with the emblem of the city: The Gateway of India and the Taj Mahal Palace, the monumental Victorian station, the university, the clock tower, and more. We’ll then visit the museum dedicated to the life of Mahatma Gandhi, the “Father of the nation”, who led India to independence. It hosts a rich collection of objects that belonged to Gandhi. Photo op at the traditional “open air laundromat”.

We’ll enjoy a gala dinner and spend the night on board.

Description.Title: BOMBAY (Mumbai)
Description.Text:
EXCURSION: Take a panoramic tour of Bombay (in the afternoon). You’ll discover the neighborhood of Colaba with the emblem of the city: The Gateway of India and the Taj Mahal Palace, the monumental Victorian station, the university, the clock tower, and more. We’ll then visit the museum dedicated to the life of Mahatma Gandhi.

We’ll enjoy a gala dinner and spend the night on board.

Description.Title: BOMBAY
Description.Text:
EXCURSION: Elephanta island (in the morning)

Elephanta island is famous because it is home to the “city of caves”, a collection of archaeological cave temples dedicated to the Hindu god Shiva.  This first class rupestrian site was added to UNESCO’s list in 1987 and bears witness to its rich past. We’ll gain access to the sight on small boats. The caves are divided into two groups: Five Hindu caves and two Buddhist caves that were carved directly into the mountain. Its masterpiece is the monumental seven-meter sculpture representing Shiva in three forms: the creator, the protector, and the destroyer.

We’ll return to the ship. We’ll enjoy lunch on board. End of our services at 2:00 p.m.

Description.Title: BOMBAY
Description.Text:
EXCURSION: Elephanta island (in the morning). Elephanta island is famous because it is home to the “city of caves”, a collection of archaeological cave temples dedicated to the Hindu god Shiva.

We’ll return to the ship. We’ll enjoy lunch on board. End of our services at 2:00 p.m.
Tour India by cruise between Madras, Sri Lanka and Bombay

Description.Title: Our strengths
Description.Text: Cruise to two fascinating countries and let yourself be guided on this grand tour of India and Sri Lanka. Like the great men who forged their history, you will arrive by sea to discover several Indian States: Tamil Nadu and its old trading posts, Kerala with its backwaters, Goa with its many places of worship and finally, one of the richest states—Maharashtra, with its vibrant capital city Bombay and the museum dedicated to Gandhi, known as the Father of the Nation.

Description.Title: Highlights
Description.Text:
HIGHLIGHTS

  • EXCURSIONS INCLUDED
  • Visits to 3 destinations listed as UNESCO world heritage sites 
    • The site of Mahabalipuram in Madras
    • The churches and convents of Goa
    • The Victorian Neo-Gothic ensembles and Elephanta Island of Bombay
  • A day in the Backwaters of Kerala
  • Colombo and its living museum that retraces the life of a traditional village
  • The museum dedicated to the life of Gandhi in Bombay

Description.Title: Formalities
Description.Text: Please consult the competent authorities (consulate/embassy) before your trip. The use of mosquito repellent is highly recommended.

Description.Title: Additional information
Description.Text:
INTERNET

SATELLITE CONNECTIONS

Our ship provides Internet connection via satellite while we cruise, which is different and slower than what we are used to through our regular home or office services. We cannot guarantee connection at all times. Please keep this in mind while you are enjoying your vacation with us.

TELEPHONE SERVICE

DURING CRUISE

When we are at sea, you can connect your device(s) to the onboard GSM/3G network. Your service provider will automatically send you the terms and conditions of use for this service. You will be able to make calls, send messages, or use the Internet through this network’s roaming services. The GSM network will be turned off once the ship enters a port.

WHILE IN PORT

When the ship is in a port, you will be able to receive and make calls via your international calling/service plan according to the country you are visiting.

WATCH OUT FOR SERVICE FEES

We strongly recommend that you contact your service provider before your departure; international calls and data usage can be very costly and are almost never included in basic operator packages.

PLEASE CHECK THE SETTINGS FOR YOUR DEVICE

Once you are on board, but before you connect to the Internet, please check the settings for your device(s).  We request that you limit the downloading of videos and large-volume files. Automatic updates to your PC, tablet, and smartphones will affect the speed and cost of your connection. You probably have automatic updates for apps on your devices that you are not aware of. We recommend that you deactivate these updates while you are staying with us.

Description.Title: Useful information
Description.Text:
EXCURSIONS:

  • Excursions are only available for purchase up to 15 days before your trip begins.
  • Excursions will alternate between air-conditioned buses, small local boats, or rickshaws.
  • The excursions will be narrated by a local, French-speaking tour guide, and you will have earphones for easier listening.
  • Frequent traffic jams in large Indian cities, caused by intense traffic or religious events, can disturb the sequence of certain excursions.

PRECAUTIONS

Vaccines are not mandatory for this trip. It is nevertheless advisable to be up to date with the following vaccinations: tetanus, polio, hepatitis A and B, diphtheria, and typhoid fever. The use of mosquito repellent is highly recommended.

CURRENCY EXCHANGE

The Indian and Sri Lankan rupee: please consult websites such as www.xe.com or www.oanda.com/currency/converter/.

Payment using credit or debit cards is not current practice, but you will be able to withdraw money easily. There is no currency exchange service on board.

WEATHER

In terms of weather, the best period for visiting India and Sri Lanka is from the end of November to the end of March, regardless of the region visited. This will allow you to avoid both the monsoon season and unbearable summer heat. The temperature oscillates between 15°C and 32 °C (59°- 90° Fahrenheit) in India, and in Sri Lanka, the temperature is relatively constant at this time of year: 27°C (80°F).

TIME DIFFERENCE

You can consult www.worldtimezone.com to see the time difference between your home and your destination.

Description.Title: Mentions
Description.Text:
These cruises and tours are not recommended for persons with reduced mobility. You must be in good physical condition to participate as most visits are done on foot.

The captain of the ship is the sole authority who can modify the ship itinerary for safety or navigational reasons.

The excursions can be modified and the order of the visits can be reversed in the event of technical difficulties or local, cultural or sporting events. The local authorities can decide to close certain sites or museums at any time and for any reason. If this happens, we will propose an alternative. 

Alcohol can be dangerous to your health. Please drink in moderation.

Valid information for year 2020

Description.Title: AJACCIO
Description.Text: Passengers are welcome to board at 6:00 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we’ll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. Tonight, we’ll enjoy dinner, an evening of activities on board and remain in port overnight.

Description.Title: AJACCIO
Description.Text: Passengers are welcome to board at 6:00 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we’ll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. Tonight, we’ll enjoy dinner, an evening of activities on board and remain in port overnight.

Description.Title: AJACCIO
Description.Text:
Join us for an excursion this morning through the Corsican maquis. You’ll discover untamed Corsica and one of the most beautiful valleys in the region as you plunge into the heart of the maquis. We’ll also enjoy a tasting of local cheese and cold cuts.

This afternoon, we’ll set out on an excursion to Ajaccio and the Îles Sanguinaires. We’ll first follow Napoleon’s trail through the old city before visiting the captivating beauty found on the outlying islands.

Our ship will cruise to Bonifacio. Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: AJACCIO
Description.Text:
Join us for an excursion this morning through the Corsican maquis. We’ll also enjoy a tasting of local cheese and cold cuts.

This afternoon, we’ll set out on an excursion to Ajaccio and the Îles Sanguinaires.

Our ship will cruise to Bonifacio. Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: BONIFACIO
Description.Text:
This morning, we’ll set out on a guided tour of Bonifacio. Bonifacio is rich with a history told along its small streets and paths, a thousand-year-old fortress, and the sturdy stone homes perched high above the sea waves. The descent (and subsequent ascent) of the King of Aragon’s Stairway will provide some of the best views on the trip (187 steps).

Enjoy a free afternoon on your own or join us for an excursion to the nature reserve on the Lavezzi Islands. The island is scattered with sculpted granite boulders and has a network of clearly marked footpaths to take in all the views. After our tour, we’ll continue to cruise towards Porto Vecchio as we drift by nature reserves and splendid seascapes dotted with faraway islands. Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: BONIFACIO
Description.Text:
This morning, we’ll set out on a guided tour of Bonifacio. The descent (and subsequent ascent) of the King of Aragon’s Stairway will provide some of the best views on the trip (187 steps).

Enjoy a free afternoon on your own or join us for an excursion to the nature reserve on the Lavezzi Islands. 

After our tour, we’ll continue to cruise towards Porto Vecchio. Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: PORTO VECCHIO
Description.Text:
In the morning, we’ll set out on a guided tour of Porto Vecchio. The old town includes the ruins of a 16th-century citadel and gorgeous views of the marina.

The afternoon will be spent cruising to Bastia. Enjoy the onboard activities during this time.

Description.Title: PORTO VECCHIO
Description.Text:
In the morning, we’ll set out on a guided tour of Porto Vecchio. The old town includes the ruins of a 16th-century citadel and gorgeous views of the marina.

The afternoon will be spent cruising to Bastia. Enjoy the onboard activities during this time.

Description.Title: BASTIA
Description.Text:
Join us for an excursion to Cap Corse (including lunch). Located to the north of Bastia and Saint-Florent, Cap Corse is a 25-mile long promontory with several attractive fishing villages, a gorgeous coastline, and a couple of good beaches. We'll enjoy a tasting of local wine, cold-cuts, and cheese.

After our tour, we continue to cruise towards l’Ile Rousse.

Description.Title: BASTIA
Description.Text:
Join us for an excursion to Cap Corse. We'll enjoy a tasting* of local wine, cold-cuts, and cheese.

After our tour, we continue to cruise towards l’Ile Rousse.

Description.Title: L'ILE ROUSSE
Description.Text:
This morning, join us for a tour of Calvi and its citadel. You’ll discover its huge marina and immense bay surrounded by its unique landscape and often snow-capped mountains. We’ll head toward Notre Dame de la Serra to get a magnificent view of the gulf. Our tour will continue at the citadel. The symbol of the town of Calvi, it was built during the Genoese occupation.

OR

Discover the old villages in the Balagne Region on a tour.  These are the fertile hills of the island—commonly referred to as the Corsican gardens— where there are more than thirty villages perched on cliffs or hidden in narrow valleys.

Relax during the afternoon cruise towards the Gulf of Girolata and enjoy the scenery as we pass by the Scandola Nature Reserve and watch the sun set.

Description.Title: L'ILE ROUSSE
Description.Text:
This morning, join us for a tour of Calvi and its citadel.

OR

Discover the old villages in the Balagne Region on a tour. 

Relax during the afternoon cruise towards the Gulf of Girolata and enjoy the scenery as we pass by the Scandola Nature Reserve and watch the sun set.

Description.Title: AJACCIO - The Calanques de Piana
Description.Text:
We’ll spend the morning cruising and the afternoon on an excursion to the Calanques de Piana. These sheer cliffs and rock sculptures seem to jet up from the water and radiate a red hue along the coastline. During our tour, we’ll also stop at one of the panoramic viewpoints to admire the amazing landscape.

Tonight is our festive gala evening.

Description.Title: AJACCIO - The Calanques de Piana

We’ll spend the morning cruising and the afternoon on an excursion to the Calanques de Piana. During our tour, we’ll also stop at one of the panoramic viewpoints to admire the amazing landscape.

    • The picturesque perched villages lost in the hills of the Balagne Region or Calvi

    • Enjoy a tasting of regional products

Description.Title: BARCELONA
Description.Text:
This morning, we’ll set out on a guided tour of Barcelona. This seaside city contains historic treasures that span 2,000 years: Roman ruins, medieval districts, and Modernism masterpieces. We’ll visit the Gothic Quarter and its narrow streets filled with trendy bars, nightclubs, and restaurants. The next stop will be La Boqueria Market for a taste of some Spanish cold cuts.

In the afternoon, join us for a tour of La Sagrada Familia, Antoni Gaudi’s magnum opus. The magnificent building has been under construction since 1882 and is an absolute must-see when in Barcelona. The church is expected to be finished in 2026, a century after Gaudi’s death. Although the building is surrounded by cranes and scaffolding, its fascinating and quirky beauty remain inside and out. Afterward, we'll take a stroll through Park Güell, another Gaudi urban masterpiece. The now-public park began as a private estate back in the 1800s.  Gaudi was commissioned by Eusebi Güell to remodel the house and build a perimeter wall with gates. The renowned architect also helped design the estate’s gardens, building a pergola and two fountains.

Join us for an evening of dinner and dancing. Our ship will cruise to Palma overnight.

Description.Title: BARCELONA
Description.Text:
This morning, we’ll set out on a guided tour of Barcelona. The next stop will be La Boqueria Market for a taste of some Spanish cold cuts.

In the afternoon, join us for a tour of La Sagrada Familia, Antoni Gaudi’s magnum opus. Afterward, we'll take a stroll through Park Güell, another Gaudi urban masterpiece.

Join us for an evening of dinner and dancing. Our ship will cruise to Palma overnight.

Description.Title: PALMA
Description.Text:
Join us for a full-day excursion to discover Mallorca (lunch included). We’ll visit Valldemossa, a village steeped in old-world charm and tucked in the middle of the mountains. Our tour includes the Valldemossa Charterhouse and King Sancho's Palace. The next stop is Fornalutx, one of the most charming villages in Spain. We’ll then head to the island’s capital, Palma. We’ll travel through the lovely small streets of its historic district to pay a visit to the imposing 14th-century cathedral, known as La Seu.

After our excursion, we'll begin to cruise to Valencia. Join us for an evening of dinner and dancing.

Description.Title: PALMA
Description.Text:
Join us for a full-day excursion to discover Mallorca.

After our excursion, we'll begin to cruise to Valencia. Join us for an evening of dinner and dancing.

Description.Title: VALENCIA
Description.Text:
This morning, we’ll set out on a guided tour of Valencia. Spain's third-largest city has a thriving cultural and social scene basked in a wonderful climate. Its architecture displays a range of over 2,000 years, including striking futuristic buildings built from the turn of this century. Valencia owes its prominence to its strategic location on the sea; for centuries, it was Spain’s gateway to Mediterranean trading.

OR Join us for an excursion along the Route of the Borgias. The cultural route traces the history of one of the most influential families in Spain: The Borgias. Along our way, we’ll visit the Cistercian Monastery of Santa María de la Valldigna and then Francis Borgia College in Gandia. We’ll take in some of the major sites in Gandia, including the Moorish Quarter and the outside of the Ducal Palace, which was home to the Borgias family beginning in 1485.

You’re free to do as you please in the afternoon. Our ship will cruise to Cartagena. Join us for an evening of dinner and dancing.

Description.Title: VALENCIA
Description.Text:
This morning, we’ll set out on a guided tour of Valencia. Spain's third-largest city has a thriving cultural and social scene basked in a wonderful climate.

OR Join us for an excursion along the Route of the Borgias. The cultural route traces the history of one of the most influential families in Spain: The Borgias.

You’re free to do as you please in the afternoon. Our ship will cruise to Cartagena. Join us for an evening of dinner and dancing.

Description.Title: CARTAGENA
Description.Text:
This morning, we’ll set out on a guided tour of Murcia. This sun-drenched city has a fascinating history and grand Baroque architecture. The center of the city has the feel of a small town, and nothing feels rushed. The cathedral is considered a Baroque masterpiece, but since it took several hundred years to complete, the interior is, ironically, Gothic.

Enjoy some free time on your own in Cartagena this afternoon. Our ship will begin to cruise towards Malaga. Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: CARTAGENA
Description.Text:
This morning, we’ll set out on a guided tour of Murcia. This sun-drenched city has a fascinating history and grand Baroque architecture.

Enjoy some free time on your own in Cartagena this afternoon. Our ship will begin to cruise towards Malaga. Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: MALAGA
Description.Text:
We’ll spend the morning cruising.

On our arrival in the afternoon, join us for a tour of the city where Pablo Picasso was born. Located at the mouth of the Guadalmedina River, Malaga is one of the oldest Mediterranean seaports. Dominated by its Moorish castle perched on the Mount of Gibralfaro, the city offers stunning scenery, tree-lined promenades, great weather, tiny boutiques, and excellent restaurants. We’ll visit the Picasso Foundation Birthplace Museum in the building where he was born in 1881, which houses works and personal belongings from the artist and his family. The collection includes engravings, books, illustrations, drawings, and lithographs.

Our ship will begin to cruise towards Malaga. Join us for an evening of dinner and dancing.

Description.Title: MALAGA
Description.Text:
We’ll spend the morning cruising.

On our arrival in the afternoon, join us for a tour of the city where Pablo Picasso was born. We’ll visit the Picasso Foundation Birthplace Museum in the building where he was born in 1881, which houses works and personal belongings from the artist and his family.

Our ship will begin to cruise towards Malaga. Join us for an evening of dinner and dancing.

Description.Title: CADIZ
Description.Text:
We’ll spend the morning on a guided visit of Cadiz. Located on the Andalusian coastline known as Costa de la Luz, Cádiz is tucked between lavish lagoons, sprawling beaches, and rich salt marshes. The ancient center of the city—which is almost 4,000 years old—is surrounded almost entirely by water. We’ll visit the largely Baroque-style cathedral that was built between 1722 and 1838—the city’s golden age.

In the afternoon, we'll head out on an excursion to Jerez de la Frontera. We’ll visit a “ganadería,” where bulls and horses are raised, and learn about this living symbol of Spanish culture. You’ll discover the life of these beautiful animals in the freedom of the Andalusian countryside. After, we’ll continue our excursion at the Tio Pepe winery (or similar establishment), where we’ll have a taste* one of the best wines in Spain.

Our ship will cruise towards Portimao. Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: CADIZ
Description.Text:
We’ll spend the morning on a guided visit of Cadiz. We’ll visit the largely Baroque-style cathedral that was built between 1722 and 1838—the city’s golden age.

In the afternoon, we'll head out on an excursion to Jerez de la Frontera. We’ll visit a “ganadería. After, we’ll continue our excursion at the Tio Pepe winery (or similar establishment), where we’ll have a taste* one of the best wines in Spain.

Our ship will cruise towards Portimao. Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: PORTIMAO
Description.Text:
We’ll spend the morning on a guided visit of the Algarve Region. The Algarve Region is overflowing with history, adventure, gorgeous beaches, and stunning vistas. Our tour will take you to the highlights of this area, including Lagos, one of the prettiest cities, and the stunning Ponta de Piedade cliffs of nearby. We’ll then spend some time in historic and delightful Silves.

The afternoon will be spent cruising to Lisbon. We will pass by Cape St. Vincent, the southwesternmost point of mainland Europe.

Description.Title: PORTIMAO
Description.Text:
We’ll spend the morning on a guided visit of the Algarve Region. Our tour will take you to the highlights of this area, including Lagos, one of the prettiest cities, and the stunning Ponta de Piedade cliffs of nearby.

The afternoon will be spent cruising to Lisbon. We will pass by Cape St. Vincent, the southwesternmost point of mainland Europe.

Description.Title: LISBON
Description.Text:
This morning, we’ll set out on a guided tour of Portugal’s “City of Light,” Lisbon. During our panoramic tour, you’ll see Monument of the Discoveries, an homage to the glorious past of the country’s exploration across the seas, as well as the famous tower set in the port waters, Belém Tower. We’ll also see the Hieronymites Monastery, an impressive symbol of the country’s wealth and power during the Age of Discovery (closed on Mondays). During our visit, we’ll enjoy a tasting of the original Pasteis de Belem, following an ancient recipe from the monastery.

In the afternoon, we’ll spend time exploring the labyrinth of streets in one of the oldest districts in the city, Alfama, and in Mouraria, the birthplace of Fado music. Alfama is the historic core of Lisbon, its heart and soul, and an essential stop for any visitor who wants to truly get a feel for the city. Take some time to explore the district and enjoy the diverse and charismatic ambiance. Alfama is colorful, lively, and genuine, so enjoy the exceptional feeling of being in a unique neighborhood. Follow up with a stroll through the Mouraria, the city’s hippest district. It began as a ghetto for the Moors in 1147, but has now become one of the most culturally diverse areas. Not-to-be-missed sites include the Largo do Intendente, a trendy square with cafés, bars, and restaurants, and the medieval house on Largo da Achada. Maria Severa Onofriana, the first Fado singer, lived here.

Tonight is our festive gala evening.

Description.Title: Requirements
Description.Text: Valid passport required. Non-EU nationals are advised to consult their embassy or consulate.

Description.Title: Additional information
Description.Text:
INTERNET

SATELLITE CONNECTIONS

Our ship provides Internet connection via satellite while we cruise, which is different and slower than what we are used to through our regular home or office services. We cannot guarantee connection at all times. Please keep this in mind while you are enjoying your vacation with us.

TELEPHONE SERVICE

DURING CRUISE

When we are at sea, you can connect your device(s) to the onboard GSM/3G network. Your service provider will automatically send you the terms and conditions of use for this service. You will be able to make calls, send messages, or use the Internet through this network’s roaming services. The GSM network will be turned off once the ship enters a port.

WHILE IN PORT

When the ship is in a port, you will be able to receive and make calls via your international calling/service plan according to the country you are visiting.

WATCH OUT FOR SERVICE FEES

We strongly recommend that you contact your service provider before your departure; international calls and data usage can be very costly and are almost never included in basic operator packages.

PLEASE CHECK THE SETTINGS FOR YOUR DEVICE

Once you are on board, but before you connect to the Internet, please check the settings for your device(s).  We request that you limit the downloading of videos and large-volume files. Automatic updates to your PC, tablet, and smartphones will affect the speed and cost of your connection. You probably have automatic updates for apps on your devices that you are not aware of. We recommend that you deactivate these updates while you are staying with us.

Description.Text:
Warning: Navigational obligations and weather conditions can disrupt the itinerary, and in certain cases, intermediate stops may be canceled. If this happens, CroisiEurope will do our best to find the best solution according to passenger expectations. For safety reasons, the company and/or the captain of the ship are the only authorities who can modify the cruise itinerary. 2019 PRE-CRUISE PROGRAM (subject to changes).

*Alcohol can be dangerous to your health. Please drink in moderation.

Valid information for year 2020

Description.Title: FUNCHAL
Description.Text: Join us for a full-day excursion to explore the east coast of Madeira. This magical, European island sits in the middle of the Atlantic between Africa and the Americas. Wild, unpredictable, luxurious, and spellbinding, it is a perfect place to get away from it all. We’ll travel through charming villages and countryside lush with eucalyptus and mimosa trees to the spectacular overlook on Pico do Arieiro (5,964 ft./1,818 m high) to touch the clouds and take in the amazing views. We’ll then continue on the sinuous roads through Ribeiro Frio to the village of Santana, known for its colorful, triangular homes and thatched roofs. We’ll stop at the Quinta do Furao (or similar establishment) for a tour of the vineyards and a tasting of the wine. In the afternoon, we’ll go to the Portela viewpoint to take in the mountainous landscape falling directly into the ocean.

Description.Title: FUNCHAL
Description.Text: Join us for a full-day excursion to explore the east coast of Madeira. This magical, European island sits in the middle of the Atlantic between Africa and the Americas. Wild, unpredictable, luxurious, and spellbinding, it is a perfect place to get away from it all.  We’ll stop at the Quinta do Furao (or similar establishment) for a tour of the vineyards and a tasting* of the wine. In the afternoon, we’ll go to the Portela viewpoint to take in the mountainous landscape falling directly into the ocean.

Description.Title: FUNCHAL
Description.Text:
This morning, we’ll set out on a guided tour of Funchal, the vibrant capital of Madeira. Set against the backdrop of cloud-topped mountains on the southern coast of the island, the city spans across the extraordinary, steep hills and flattened terraces. We’ll explore the old town to get an authentic feel for its past. A must-see is the groundbreaking street-art program “Arte de Portas Abertas,” which has brought to life over 200 doors on Rua Santa Maria. We’ll then go to the local farmer’s market (Mercado dos Lavradores) to enjoy the colors, smells, tastes, and general ambiance. The lower section of the market is dedicated only to fish. The season determines the catch of the day. This is a great way to take part in the daily rhythm of life on the island. At the end of our tour, we’ll visit Blandy's Wine Lodge, an opportunity to experience local winemaking. Blandy's Wine Lodge is a family business, where over 650 barrels and vats age the finest wines using the traditional Canteiro process. Of course, we’ll finish up our visit with a tasting*.

OR

We'll enjoy a tour of the botanical gardens and the suburb of Monte. The Madeira Botanical Gardens is one of the most beautiful gardens in the region and also provides marvelous views overlooking the city below. The garden covers almost 377,000 square feet (35,000 m²) and is home to a fascinating collection of a wide variety of plants. After admiring the gardens, we’ll jump on the cable car to Monte Parish. The ride is breathtaking in itself, as are the panoramic views from the top. Enjoy a stroll through romantic Monte, stopping off at the church, the final resting place of Charles I, the last emperor of the Austro-Hungarian Empire.

We’ll spend the afternoon cruising.

Description.Title: PONTA DELGADA
Description.Text:
We’ll spend the morning cruising to Sao Miguel, the largest island in the Azores.

On arrival, join us for an excursion to Furnas Valley, an extraordinary and authentic area of the island known for its complex of geothermal springs tucked into lush scenery. Our next stop will be the Terra Nostra Botanical Park and its grottoes, lush avenues, winding trails, streams, and ponds. Its collections include rhododendrons from Malaysia, the unique Victoria cruziana, camellias, cycads, and over 300 varieties of ferns. We’ll then visit a tea plantation and learn about its history and production.

Description.Title: LARNACA - LIMASSOL
Description.Text: Passengers are welcome to board at 6:00 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we’ll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. We’ll have dinner and enjoy traditional Cypriot entertainment on board. While you sleep, our ship will begin to cruise to Limassol.

Description.Title: LARNACA - LIMASSOL
Description.Text: Passengers are welcome to board at 6:00 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we’ll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. We’ll have dinner and enjoy traditional Cypriot entertainment on board. While you sleep, our ship will begin to cruise to Limassol.

Description.Title: LIMASSOL
Description.Text:
After breakfast, join us for a tour of the archaeological ruins in Paphos, classified as a UNESCO World Heritage Site.  We'll visit the impressive, underground tombs dating back to the 4th century BC and sporting a distinct Egyptian influence. The remains of villas, palaces, theaters, fortresses, and tombs mean that the site is of exceptional architectural and historical value.  We'll continue to the coastal town of Yeroskipou to visit a Loukoum (Turkish Delight) factory and enjoy a tasting.

We’ll then spend the afternoon cruising to Rhodes. Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: LIMASSOL
Description.Text:
After breakfast, join us for a tour of the archaeological ruins in Paphos, classified as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. We'll continue to the coastal town of Yeroskipou to visit a Loukoum (Turkish Delight) factory and enjoy a tasting.

We’ll then spend the afternoon cruising to Rhodes. Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: RHODES
Description.Text:
We’ll spend the morning cruising.

On arrival, join us for a visit to ancient and medieval Rhodes. Our first stop will be Monte Smith and its splendid panoramic view of the island and the surrounding seascapes. We’ll pass through the impressive d’Amboise Gate to the highest point within the fortifications, the Palace of the Grand Master, an imposing fortress with relics from the medieval period as well as ancient sculptures and beautiful 1st- century mosaics. Our tour will continue on the Street of the Knights. Completely restored and preserved beautifully, it is lined by the buildings where holy warriors spent their time in prayer or military practice. Each building is an ‘inn’ for the language spoken according to the knights’ birthplace: England, France, Germany, Italy, Aragon, Auvergne, or Provence. A distinct, noble ambiance still seems to float in the air.  What we see now, though, owes much to Italian restorations during the 1930s.

Join us for an evening of dinner and dancing. Our ship will cruise to Santorini overnight.

Description.Title: RHODES
Description.Text:
We’ll spend the morning cruising.

On arrival, join us for a visit to ancient and medieval Rhodes.

Join us for an evening of dinner and dancing. Our ship will cruise to Santorini overnight.

Description.Title: SANTORINI
Description.Text:
We’ll spend the morning cruising.

In the afternoon, join us for an excursion to the island (travel to and from the island will be done in rowboats). Spend your time taking in the picturesque sites on the island, admiring the scenery from impressive vistas, or enjoying local delicacies at the Mediterranean cafés and restaurants. Our coach will bring us up to the monastery of Profitis Ilias, which offers full panoramic views of the island from the 18th-century sanctuary. We'll then head to one of the most striking villages on the island, Megalochori, to enjoy the ambiance of its historic mansions and old traditional houses. We'll stop off at a wine cellar to enjoy a tasting of the local spirits. The gorgeous village of Fira, perched on the edge of a high caldera that faces west across the sea, will be our last stop.

Description.Title: SANTORINI
Description.Text:
We’ll spend the morning cruising.

In the afternoon, join us for an excursion to the island. Our coach will bring us up to the monastery of Profitis Ilias, which offers full panoramic views of the island from the 18th-century sanctuary. We'll then head to Megalochori, to enjoy the ambiance of its historic mansions and old traditional houses. We'll stop off at a wine cellar to enjoy a tasting* of the local spirits.

Description.Title: MYKONOS - DELOS
Description.Text:
Join us for an excursion to the island of Mykonos this morning. It sits tall among the Cyclades and is dotted with charming Mediterranean villages. It is also known for its idyllic, golden beaches leading to the pristine, turquoise waters. We’ll visit the Monastery of Panagia Tourliani, the official protector of the island. Built in the 1500s, tourists visit it not only for the religious experience but for its outstanding architecture. The whitewashed exterior and colored dome house an impressive wooden altar screen, decorated with icons of saints and flowers.  We'll return to Mykonos Town to take in the pure charm of the city, one of the biggest attractions after the beach.

In the afternoon, join us for an excursion to the island of Delos (travel to and from the island will be done in rowboats). Delos has been considered a sacred island since ancient times. Greek mythology recounts the island as the birthplace of both Apollo and Artemis, and it has played an important role over many millennia as a religious and economic center. We'll visit the sanctuary dedicated to Apollo, the Terrace of the Lions, and several ruins of homes with superb mosaic art.

Our ship will cruise to Athens overnight.

Description.Title: MYKONOS - DELOS
Description.Text:
Join us for an excursion to the island of Mykonos this morning. It sits tall among the Cyclades and is dotted with charming Mediterranean villages.

In the afternoon, join us for an excursion to the island of Delos. Delos has been considered a sacred island since ancient times.

Our ship will cruise to Athens overnight.

Description.Title: ATHENS
Description.Text:
This morning, join us for a visit to Athens and the Acropolis. We’ll explore the Acropolis, an ancient religious center in Athens, which includes the Temple of Athena Nike and the iconic Parthenon. After our visit to the Acropolis, enjoy a coach tour of the capital of Greece.

The afternoon can be spent on an excursion to the Apollo Coast and Cape Sounion. The route along the coast travels around the rim of the Saronic Gulf all the way to Cape Sounion. The promontory on the southernmost tip of the Attic peninsula looks west towards Patroklos, across the Aegean Sea.  The cape is most noted for the ruins of the Temple of Poseidon, dating back to the Golden Age of Athens.

Description.Title: ATHENS
Description.Text:
This morning, join us for a visit to Athens and the Acropolis. We’ll explore the Acropolis, an ancient religious center in Athens, which includes the Temple of Athena Nike and the iconic Parthenon. After our visit to the Acropolis, enjoy a coach tour of the capital of Greece.

The afternoon can be spent on an excursion to the Apollo Coast and Cape Sounion.

Description.Title: At sea
Description.Text:
Make the most of our day at sea to kick back, relax, and let yourself be pampered on board. We’ll be cruising by the Peloponnese, so the scenery will be second to none.

Tonight is our festive gala evening.

Description.Title: At sea
Description.Text:

Description.Title: IGOUMENITSA
Description.Text:
Full-day excursion: The Meteora (approximately 5 hours of round-trip travel – lunch is included). Discover one of the most spectacular sites in Greece. Although the original town of Kalambaka was destroyed during World War II, the Meteora monasteries remained intact on the summit of the rocks. The caves in the rocks began to be inhabited by hermit monks in the 9th century AD. They began to build monasteries in the 11th century, and at its peak in the 16th century, there were 24.   Today, there are now six functioning monasteries, still inhabited by either nuns or monks.

After our visit, we’ll cast off for Dubrovnik.

Description.Title: IGOUMENITSA
Description.Text:
Full-day excursion: The Meteora. Discover one of the most spectacular sites in Greece.

After our visit, we’ll cast off for Dubrovnik.

Description.Title: DUBROVNIK
Description.Text:
We’ll spend the day cruising and admiring the Mediterranean coastlines.

Our ship will arrive in port during the evening. Join us for a tour of Dubrovnik "by night". Discover the hidden secrets of the city during our walk and admire monuments and statues illuminated by the evening lights.

Description.Title: Requirements
Description.Text: Valid passport required. Non-EU nationals are advised to consult their embassy or consulate.

Description.Title: Additional information
Description.Text:
INTERNET

SATELLITE CONNECTIONS

Our ship provides Internet connection via satellite while we cruise, which is different and slower than what we are used to through our regular home or office services. We cannot guarantee connection at all times. Please keep this in mind while you are enjoying your vacation with us.

TELEPHONE SERVICE

DURING CRUISE

When we are at sea, you can connect your device(s) to the onboard GSM/3G network. Your service provider will automatically send you the terms and conditions of use for this service. You will be able to make calls, send messages, or use the Internet through this network’s roaming services. The GSM network will be turned off once the ship enters a port.

WHILE IN PORT

When the ship is in a port, you will be able to receive and make calls via your international calling/service plan according to the country you are visiting.

WATCH OUT FOR SERVICE FEES

We strongly recommend that you contact your service provider before your departure; international calls and data usage can be very costly and are almost never included in basic operator packages.

PLEASE CHECK THE SETTINGS FOR YOUR DEVICE

Once you are on board, but before you connect to the Internet, please check the settings for your device(s).  We request that you limit the downloading of videos and large-volume files. Automatic updates to your PC, tablet, and smartphones will affect the speed and cost of your connection. You probably have automatic updates for apps on your devices that you are not aware of. We recommend that you deactivate these updates while you are staying with us.

Description.Title: DUBROVNIK
Description.Text: Passengers are welcome to board at 6:00 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we’ll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. Tonight, we’ll enjoy dinner and an evening of activities on board.

Description.Title: DUBROVNIK
Description.Text:
Join us for a visit of Dubrovnik, which captivates tourists by its beauty and sublime views.

After lunch, enjoy some free time in Dubrovnik. We suggest a walk along the ramparts of the city.(1) You’re guaranteed a fantastic view from up above!

Our ship will cruise to Otranto overnight.

Description.Title: DUBROVNIK
Description.Text:
Join us for a visit of Dubrovnik, which captivates tourists by its beauty and sublime views.

After lunch, enjoy some free time in Dubrovnik. We suggest a walk along the ramparts of the city.(1) You’re guaranteed a fantastic view from up above!

Our ship will cruise to Otranto overnight.

Description.Title: OTRANTO
Description.Text:
We’ll spend the morning on a visit to Lecce, a Baroque masterpiece of a city with dazzling surprises around every corner. Among the many architectural splendors we’ll see from the outside are the buildings in the Piazza del Duomo—including the Duomo, Bishop’s Palace, and Seminary Palace—the Roman amphitheater excavated after World War II, and the Basilica di Santa Croce.

We’ll then spend the afternoon cruising to Messina.

Description.Title: OTRANTO
Description.Text:
We’ll spend the morning on a visit to Lecce, a Baroque masterpiece of a city with dazzling surprises around every corner.

We’ll then spend the afternoon cruising to Messina.

Description.Title: MESSINA
Description.Text:
Join us for a full-day excursion, including lunch, to Mount Etna and Taormina.(2) Mount Etna is the largest active volcano in Europe, and we’ll take you up to almost 6,400 feet (1,950 m) to the Silvestri Craters near the top. The bleak lava wilderness around the summit of Etna is one of the most memorable landscapes you’ll ever see. We’ll then drive to Taormina. Nestled above the stunning Sicilian coastline, Taormina brings to life the legendary beauty of Sicily. Enjoy a tour of the area, including the ruins of its ancient Greek theater.

Our ship will cruise to Salerno overnight.

Description.Title: MESSINA
Description.Text:
Join us for a full-day excursion, including lunch, to Mount Etna and Taormina.(2) Mount Etna is the largest active volcano in Europe. We’ll then drive to Taormina. Nestled above the stunning Sicilian coastline, Taormina brings to life the legendary beauty of Sicily.

Our ship will cruise to Salerno overnight.

Description.Title: SALERNO - NAPLES
Description.Text:
This morning, we’ll set off on an excursion to visit the villages along the Amalfi Coast. The magnificent gardens in Sorrento are not to be missed.

We’ll then spend the afternoon cruising to Naples.

Description.Title: SALERNO - NAPLES
Description.Text:
This morning, we’ll set off on an excursion to visit the villages along the Amalfi Coast. The magnificent gardens in Sorrento are not to be missed.

We’ll then spend the afternoon cruising to Naples.

Description.Title: NAPLES
Description.Text:
Join us for a guided tour of Naples. The center of the city hosts a variety of palaces, museums, and tourist destinations including the Royal Palace, Galleria Umberto I shopping area, and San Carlo Opera House. Our excursion includes a visit to a local pizzeria to taste the famous Neapolitan pizza.

OR

Set out on an excursion to Pompeii, which through its tragedy has become one of the most significant resources of information on Roman art, customs, trades, and life.

We’ll then spend the afternoon cruising to Civitavecchia.

Description.Title: NAPLES
Description.Text:
Join us for a guided tour of Naples. The center of the city hosts a variety of palaces, museums, and tourist destinations. Our excursion includes a visit to a local pizzeria to taste the famous Neapolitan pizza.

OR

Set out on an excursion to Pompeii.

We’ll then spend the afternoon cruising to Civitavecchia.

Description.Title: CIVITAVECCHIA - Rome
Description.Text:
Join us for a full-day excursion to Rome, the “Eternal City” (lunch included). Our tour will include seeing the outside of celebrated sites such as the Colosseum and Roman Forum. On foot, you’ll discover the grandiose Trevi Fountain, the Pantheon, and the legendary Piazza Navona. After lunch, we’ll visit Vatican City to admire St. Peter's Square and Basilica, regarded as one of the greatest buildings of its age.

Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment. Our ship will cruise to Livorno overnight.

Description.Title: CIVITAVECCHIA - Rome
Description.Text:
Join us for a full-day excursion to Rome, the “Eternal City”. Our tour will include seeing the outside of celebrated sites such as the Colosseum and Roman Forum. After lunch, we’ll visit Vatican City.

Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment. Our ship will cruise to Livorno overnight.

Description.Title: LIVORNO - Florence - Pisa
Description.Text:
Join us for an excursion to Florence and Pisa (including lunch). Nestled among the exquisite Tuscan hills, Florence is one of the most beautiful cities in Italy. Enjoy a guided tour of the city's historic center. Florence is considered the cradle of the Renaissance and contains world-class art and exquisite cuisine. Once you’ve been to the city, you’ll understand why it is considered a “must-see.” After lunch, we'll set off for Pisa, the city that dominated the western Mediterranean in the Middle Ages thanks to its powerful fleet. Enjoy a stroll through the Piazza dei Miracoli (the Square of Miracles) to admire the exteriors of the cathedral dedicated to Santa Maria Assunta, the Baptistery, and of course, the Leaning Tower (entry fee not including in your excursion).

After our tour, we’ll begin to cruise towards Monaco.

Description.Title: LIVORNO - Florence - Pisa
Description.Text:
Join us for an excursion to Florence and Pisa. Florence is one of the most beautiful cities in Italy. After lunch, we'll set off for Pisa, the city that dominated the western Mediterranean in the Middle Ages thanks to its powerful fleet.

After our tour, we’ll begin to cruise towards Monaco.

Description.Title: MONACO - NICE
Description.Text:
In the morning, join us for a guided tour of the principality. The Rock of Monaco is a tall monolith surrounded by old quarter battlements in the heart of the City of Princes. We’ll then head to the village of Eze, along the coast, to visit the famous Fragonard perfume laboratory and factory. Discover the secrets of the brand's perfumes and cosmetics in the legendary factory tucked among the village's charming homes and cobblestone streets.

We’ll then spend the afternoon cruising to Nice. Once we arrive, join us for a tour of the city. Throughout the centuries, Nice has attracted people from all over the world because of its lovely climate and unrivaled beauty. The city has a thousand surprises in store: monuments, churches, gardens and footpaths, museums, artists, local crafts, and internationally renowned cuisine with the unmistakable flavors of garlic, olive oil, and basil. The best way to get to know Nice is by strolling through it and experiencing sites such as the great flower market in the Cours Saleya or the elegant old quarter lined with boutiques and restaurants.

Tonight is our festive gala evening.

Description.Title: MONACO - NICE
Description.Text:
In the morning, join us for a guided tour of the principality. We’ll then head to the village of Eze, along the coast, to visit the famous Fragonard perfume laboratory and factory.

We’ll then spend the afternoon cruising to Nice. Once we arrive, join us for a tour of the city. Throughout the centuries, Nice has attracted people from all over the world because of its lovely climate and unrivaled beauty.

Tonight is our festive gala evening.

Description.Title: NICE
Description.Text: Passengers are welcome to board at 6:00 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we’ll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. Tonight, we’ll enjoy dinner and an evening of activities on board. Our ship will cruise to Corsica overnight.

Description.Title: NICE
Description.Text: Passengers are welcome to board at 6:00 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we’ll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. Tonight, we’ll enjoy dinner and an evening of activities on board. Our ship will cruise to Corsica overnight.

Description.Title: L'ILE ROUSSE
Description.Text:
This morning, join us for a tour of Calvi and its citadel. You’ll discover its large marina and immense bay surrounded by its unique landscape and often snow-capped mountains. We’ll head toward Notre Dame de la Serra to get a magnificent view of the gulf. Our tour will continue at the citadel. The symbol of the town of Calvi, it was built during the Genoese occupation.

OR

Discover the old villages in the Balagne Region during an excursion. These are the fertile hills of the island, commonly referred to as the Corsican gardens. We’ll travel through the region and visit a few of the more than thirty villages perched on cliffs or hidden in narrow valleys.

Take advantage of some downtime on our afternoon cruise towards the Gulf of Girolata to enjoy the scenery as we pass by the Scandola Nature Reserve or watch the sun set.

Description.Title: L'ILE ROUSSE
Description.Text:
This morning, join us for a tour of Calvi and its citadel.

OR

Discover the old villages in the Balagne Region during an excursion.

Take advantage of some downtime on our afternoon cruise towards the Gulf of Girolata.

Description.Title: AJACCIO - The Calanques de Piana
Description.Text: We’ll spend the morning cruising and the afternoon on an excursion to the Calanques de Piana. These sheer cliffs and rock sculptures seem to jet up from the water and radiate a red hue along the coastline. During our tour, we’ll also stop at one of the panoramic viewpoints to admire the amazing landscape.

Description.Title: AJACCIO - The Calanques de Piana
Description.Text: We’ll spend the morning cruising and the afternoon on an excursion to the Calanques de Piana. These sheer cliffs and rock sculptures seem to jet up from the water and radiate a red hue along the coastline.

Description.Title: AJACCIO
Description.Text:
Join us for an excursion this morning through the Corsican maquis. You’ll discover untamed Corsica and one of the most beautiful valleys in the region as you plunge into the heart of the Corsican maquis. We’ll also enjoy a tasting of local cheese and cold cuts.

This afternoon, we’ll set out on an excursion to Ajaccio and the Îles Sanguinaires. We’ll first follow Napoleon’s trail through the old city before visiting the captivating beauty found on the outlying islands.

Our ship will cruise to Bonifacio. Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: AJACCIO
Description.Text:
Join us for an excursion this morning through the Corsican maquis. We’ll also enjoy a tasting of local cheese and cold cuts.

This afternoon, we’ll set out on an excursion to Ajaccio and the Îles Sanguinaires.

Our ship will cruise to Bonifacio. Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: BONIFACIO
Description.Text:
This morning, we’ll set out on a tour of Bonifacio. The city is rich with a history told among its small streets and paths, a thousand-year-old fortress, and the sturdy stone homes perched high above the sea waves. The descent (and subsequent ascent) of the King of Aragon’s Stairway will provide some of the best views on the trip (187 steps) .

Enjoy a free afternoon on your own or join us for an excursion to the nature reserve on the Archipelago of Lavezzi. The islands are scattered with sculpted granite boulders and have a network of clearly marked footpaths to take in all the views. We’ll return on board to cruise towards Porto Vecchio as we drift by nature reserves and splendid seascapes dotted with faraway islands. Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: BONIFACIO
Description.Text:
This morning, we’ll set out on a guided tour of Bonifacio. The descent (and subsequent ascent) of the King of Aragon’s Stairway will provide some of the best views on the trip (187 steps) .

Enjoy a free afternoon on your own or join us for an excursion to the nature reserve on the Archipelago of Lavezzi. We’ll return on board to cruise towards Porto Vecchio. Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: PORTO VECCHIO
Description.Text:
In the morning, we’ll set out on a guided tour of Porto Vecchio. The old town includes the ruins of a 16th-century citadel and gorgeous views of the marina. 

The afternoon will be spent cruising to Bastia. Feel free to take part in some of the onboard activities offered.

Description.Title: PORTO VECCHIO
Description.Text:
In the morning, we’ll set out on a guided tour of Porto Vecchio. The old town includes the ruins of a 16th-century citadel and gorgeous views of the marina. 

The afternoon will be spent cruising to Bastia. Feel free to take part in some of the onboard activities offered.

Description.Title: BASTIA
Description.Text: Join us for an excursion to Cap Corse (including lunch). Located to the north of Bastia and Saint-Florent, Cap Corse is a 25-mile long promontory with several attractive fishing villages, a gorgeous coastline, and a couple of good beaches. We’ll enjoy a tasting* of local wine, cold-cuts, and cheese before returning on board to cruise towards Nice. Tonight is our festive gala evening.

Description.Title: Additional information
Description.Text:
INTERNET

SATELLITE CONNECTIONS

Our ship provides Internet connection via satellite while we cruise, which is different and slower than what we are used to through our regular home or office services. We cannot guarantee connection at all times. Please keep this in mind while you are enjoying your vacation with us.

TELEPHONE SERVICE

DURING CRUISE

When we are at sea, you can connect your device(s) to the onboard GSM/3G network. Your service provider will automatically send you the terms and conditions of use for this service. You will be able to make calls, send messages, or use the Internet through this network’s roaming services. The GSM network will be turned off once the ship enters a port.

WHILE IN PORT

When the ship is in a port, you will be able to receive and make calls via your international calling/service plan according to the country you are visiting.

WATCH OUT FOR SERVICE FEES

We strongly recommend that you contact your service provider before your departure; international calls and data usage can be very costly and are almost never included in basic operator packages.

PLEASE CHECK THE SETTINGS FOR YOUR DEVICE

Once you are on board, but before you connect to the Internet, please check the settings for your device(s).  We request that you limit the downloading of videos and large-volume files. Automatic updates to your PC, tablet, and smartphones will affect the speed and cost of your connection. You probably have automatic updates for apps on your devices that you are not aware of. We recommend that you deactivate these updates while you are staying with us.

Description.Title: NICE
Description.Text: Passengers are welcome to board at 6:00 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we’ll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. Tonight, we’ll enjoy dinner, an evening of activities on board, and remain in port overnight.

Description.Title: NICE
Description.Text: Passengers are welcome to board at 6:00 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we’ll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. Tonight, we’ll enjoy dinner, an evening of activities on board, and remain in port overnight.

Description.Title: NICE
Description.Text:
In the morning, join us for a guided tour of this seaside city. Throughout the centuries, Nice has attracted people from all over the world because of its lovely climate and unrivaled beauty. Nice has a thousand surprises in store: monuments, churches, gardens and footpaths, museums, artists, local crafts, and internationally renowned cuisine with the unmistakable flavors of garlic, olive oil, and basil.

In the afternoon, we’ll set out on an excursion to Saint-Paul-de-Vence. Perched high on a cliff and surrounded by walls, Saint-Paul-de-Vence is known as one of the most beautiful villages in Provence. The beauty of its location, laid-back lifestyle, and exceptional light cast from the sun have inspired many the artist, writer, poet, and painter over the centuries.

Our ship will begin to cruise to Corsica. Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: NICE
Description.Text:
In the morning, join us for a guided tour of this seaside city. Throughout the centuries, Nice has attracted people from all over the world because of its lovely climate and unrivaled beauty.

In the afternoon, we’ll set out on an excursion to Saint-Paul-de-Vence, which is known as one of the most beautiful villages in Provence.

Our ship will begin to cruise to Corsica. Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: L'ILE ROUSSE
Description.Text:
This morning, join us for a tour of Calvi and its citadel. You’ll discover its huge marina and immense bay surrounded by its unique landscape and often snow-capped mountains. We’ll head toward Notre Dame de la Serra to get a magnificent view of the gulf. Our tour will continue at the citadel. The symbol of the town of Calvi, it was built during the Genoese occupation.

In the afternoon, we'll set out on a tour of the Balagne Region. These are the fertile hills of the island—commonly referred to as the Corsican gardens—where there are more than thirty villages perched on cliffs or hidden in narrow valleys.

Our ship will cruise to Bastia overnight. Join us for an evening of dinner and dancing.

Description.Title: L'ILE ROUSSE
Description.Text:
This morning, join us for a tour of Calvi and its citadel.

In the afternoon, we'll set out on a tour of the Balagne Region. These are the fertile hills of the island—commonly referred to as the Corsican gardens—where there are more than thirty villages perched on cliffs or hidden in narrow valleys.

Our ship will cruise to Bastia overnight. Join us for an evening of dinner and dancing.

Description.Title: BASTIA
Description.Text:
Join us for an excursion to Cap Corse (including lunch). Located to the north of Bastia and Saint-Florent, Cap Corse is a 25-mile long promontory with several attractive fishing villages, a gorgeous coastline, and a couple of good beaches. We’ll enjoy a tasting of local wine, cold-cuts, and cheese.

Our ship will cruise to Olbia overnight.

Description.Title: BASTIA
Description.Text:
Join us for an excursion to Cap Corse. We’ll enjoy a tasting* of local wine, cold-cuts, and cheese.

Our ship will cruise to Olbia overnight.

Description.Title: OLBIA
Description.Text:
Our day will be dedicated to a full-day excursion along Sardinia’s Costa Smeralda—the Emerald Coast— to take in the beaches lapped by crystal-clear waters, and the scenery dotted with cliffs, bays, and coves. Starting at the charming port-town of Palau, our first stop will be Maddalena Island in the Maddalena Archipelago, a seven-island national park that has been sculpted by the wind and waves. There is nothing more relaxing than a day on an island straight out of paradise. 

Our ship will begin to cruise to Bonifacio.

Description.Title: OLBIA
Description.Text:
Our day will be dedicated to a full-day excursion along Sardinia’s Costa Smeralda—the Emerald Coast— to take in the beaches lapped by crystal-clear waters, and the scenery dotted with cliffs, bays, and coves.

Our ship will begin to cruise to Bonifacio.

Description.Title: BONIFACIO
Description.Text:
Enjoy a guided tour of Bonifacio. The city is rich with a history told among its small streets and paths, a thousand-year-old fortress, and the sturdy stone homes perched high above the sea waves. The descent (and subsequent ascent) of the King of Aragon’s Stairway will provide some of the best views on the trip (187 steps).

Enjoy a free afternoon on your own or join us for an excursion to the nature reserve on the Lavezzi Islands. The islands are scattered with sculpted granite boulders and have a network of clearly marked footpaths to take in all the views.

After our tour, we’ll return on board and begin to cruise to Ajaccio. Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: BONIFACIO
Description.Text:
Enjoy a guided tour of Bonifacio.

Enjoy a free afternoon on your own or join us for an excursion to the nature reserve on the Lavezzi Islands. The islands are scattered with sculpted granite boulders and have a network of clearly marked footpaths to take in all the views.

After our tour, we’ll return on board and begin to cruise to Ajaccio. Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: AJACCIO
Description.Text:
This morning, we’ll set out on an excursion to Ajaccio and the Îles Sanguinaires. We’ll first follow Napoleon’s trail through the old city before visiting the captivating beauty found on the outlying islands.

The afternoon will be dedicated to an excursion to the Calanques de Piana. These sheer cliffs and rock sculptures seem to jet up from the water and radiate a red hue along the coastline. During our tour, we’ll also stop at one of the panoramic viewpoints to admire the amazing landscape.

Tonight is our festive gala evening.

Description.Title: DUBROVNIK
Description.Text: Passengers are welcome to board at 6:00 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we’ll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. Tonight, we’ll enjoy dinner and an evening of activities on board.

Description.Title: DURRËS
Description.Text:
We’ll spend the morning on a guided tour of Tirana, the capital and largest city in Albania and the heart of the country's cultural, economic, and governmental activity. We’ll see Skanderbeg Square, the city center surrounded by important government buildings, as well as the historic Et'hem Bey Mosque (the mosque is closed during prayers - please wear appropriate clothing: your legs and shoulders must be covered; women need scarves for their hair).

We’ll spend the afternoon cruising.

Description.Title: DURRËS
Description.Text:
We’ll spend the morning on a guided tour of Tirana, the capital and largest city in Albania and the heart of the country's cultural, economic, and governmental activity.

We’ll spend the afternoon cruising.

Description.Title: IGOUMENITSA - The Meteora
Description.Text:
Full-day Excursion: The Meteora (approximately 5 hours of round-trip travel – lunch is included). Discover one of the most spectacular sites in Greece. Although the original town of Kalambaka was destroyed during World War II, the Meteora monasteries remained intact on the summit of the rocks. The caves in the rocks were inhabited by hermit monks in the 9th century AD. They began to build monasteries in the 11th century, and at its peak in the 16th century, there were 24. Today, there are now six functioning monasteries still inhabited by either nuns or monks.

Our ship will cruise to Itea overnight.

Description.Title: IGOUMENITSA - The Meteora
Description.Text:
Full-day Excursion: The Meteora. Discover one of the most spectacular sites in Greece. Although the original town of Kalambaka was destroyed during World War II, the Meteora monasteries remained intact on the summit of the rocks.

Our ship will cruise to Itea overnight.

Description.Title: ITEA
Description.Text:
We’ll spend the morning cruising.

The afternoon will be dedicated to an excursion on a tour of Delphi, a sacred site said to have been founded by Zeus. In ancient Greece, thousands upon thousands of pilgrims flocked here to hear the Oracle give her predictions. While taking in the ruins of the ancient site overlooking the superb red sandstone landscape, you’ll understand why Delphi was once thought to be the center of the world.

Tonight is our festive gala evening.

Description.Title: ITEA
Description.Text:
We’ll spend the morning cruising.

The afternoon will be dedicated to an excursion on a tour of Delphi, a sacred site said to have been founded by Zeus. While taking in the ruins of the ancient site overlooking the superb red sandstone landscape, you’ll understand why Delphi was once thought to be the center of the world.

Tonight is our festive gala evening.

Description.Title: Corinth Canal - ATHENS
Description.Text:
We’ll spend the morning cruising and pass through the famous Corinth Canal—one of the highlights of our cruise. After a failed effort to build the canal in the 1st century AD, the modern canal was completed in 1893. It is 4 miles long (6.4 km) and only 70 feet wide (21.4 m). 

In the afternoon, join us for a visit to Athens and the Acropolis. We’ll explore the Acropolis, an ancient religious center in Athens, which includes the Temple of Athena Nike and the iconic Parthenon. After our visit, enjoy a coach tour of the capital of Greece.

Tonight, we’ll enjoy a traditional Greek-style evening on board.

Description.Title: Corinth Canal - ATHENS

In the afternoon, join us for a visit to Athens and the Acropolis. After our visit, enjoy a coach tour of the capital of Greece.

Tonight, we’ll enjoy a traditional Greek-style evening on board.
