Description.Title: ATHENS
Description.Text: Passengers are welcome to board at 6:00 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we’ll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. We’ll have dinner and enjoy traditional Greek entertainment on board.

Description.Title: ATHENS
Description.Text: Passengers are welcome to board at 6:00 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we’ll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. We’ll have dinner and enjoy traditional Greek entertainment on board.

Description.Title: ATHENS
Description.Text:
This morning, join us for a visit to Athens and the Acropolis. We’ll explore the Acropolis, an ancient religious center in Athens, which includes the Temple of Athena Nike and the iconic Parthenon. After our visit, enjoy a coach tour of the capital of Greece.

The afternoon can be spent on an excursion to the Apollo Coast and Cape Sounion. The route along the coast travels around the rim of the Saronic Gulf all the way to Cape Sounion. The promontory on the southernmost tip of the Attic peninsula looks west towards Patroklos, across the Aegean Sea. The cape is most noted for the ruins of the Temple of Poseidon, dating back to the Golden Age of Athens.

After our tour, we’ll begin to cruise towards Delos.

Description.Title: ATHENS
Description.Text:
This morning, join us for a visit to Athens and the Acropolis. After our visit, enjoy a coach tour of the capital of Greece.

The afternoon can be spent on an excursion to the Apollo Coast and Cape Sounion. 

After our tour, we’ll begin to cruise towards Delos.

Description.Title: DELOS - MYKONOS
Description.Text:
This morning, join us for an excursion to the island of Delos (travel to and from the island will be done in rowboats). Delos has been considered a sacred island since ancient times. Greek mythology recounts the island as the birthplace of both Apollo and Artemis, and it has played an important role over many millennia as a religious and economic center. We'll visit the sanctuary dedicated to Apollo, the Terrace of the Lions, and several ruins of homes with superb mosaic art.

In the afternoon, we'll set out on an excursion to the island of Mykonos. It sits tall among the Cyclades and is dotted with charming Mediterranean villages. It is also known for its idyllic, golden beaches leading to the pristine, turquoise waters. We’ll visit the Monastery of Panagia Tourliani, the official protector of the island. Built in the 1500s, tourists visit it not only for the religious experience but for its outstanding architecture. The whitewashed exterior and colored dome houses an impressive wooden altar screen, decorated with icons of saints and flowers. We'll return to Mykonos Town to take in the pure charm of the city, one of the biggest attractions after the beach.

After our tour, we’ll begin to cruise towards Santorini.

Description.Title: DELOS - MYKONOS
Description.Text:
This morning, join us for an excursion to the island of Delos. Delos has been considered a sacred island since ancient times.

In the afternoon, we'll set out on an excursion to the island of Mykonos. It sits tall among the Cyclades and is dotted with charming Mediterranean villages.

After our tour, we’ll begin to cruise towards Santorini.

Description.Title: SANTORINI
Description.Text:
This morning, join us for an excursion to the island of Santorini (travel to and from the island will be done in rowboats). Spend your time taking in the picturesque sites on the island, admiring the scenery from impressive vistas, or enjoying local delicacies at the Mediterranean cafés and restaurants. Our coach will bring us up to the monastery of Profitis Ilias, which offers full panoramic views of the island from the 18th-century sanctuary. We'll then head one of the most striking villages on the island, Megalochori, to enjoy the ambiance of its historic mansions and old traditional houses. We'll stop off at a wine cellar for a tasting* of the local spirits. The gorgeous village of Fira, perched on the edge of a high caldera that faces west across the sea, will be our last stop.

We’ll begin to cruise to Rhodes.

Description.Title: SANTORINI
Description.Text:
This morning, join us for an excursion to the island of Santorini. Spend your time taking in the picturesque sites on the island. We'll stop off at a wine cellar for a tasting* of the local spirits.

We’ll begin to cruise to Rhodes.

Description.Title: RHODES
Description.Text:
In the morning, join us for a visit to ancient and medieval Rhodes. Our first stop will be Monte Smith and its splendid panoramic view of the island and the surrounding seascapes. We’ll pass through the impressive d’Amboise Gate to the highest point within the fortifications, the Palace of the Grand Master, an imposing fortress with relics from the medieval period as well as ancient sculptures and beautiful 1st-century mosaics. Our tour will continue on the Street of the Knights. Completely restored and beautifully preserved, it is lined by the buildings where holy warriors spent their time in prayer or military practice. Each building is an ‘inn’ for the language spoken according to the knights’ birthplace: England, France, Germany, Italy, Aragon, Auvergne, or Provence. A distinct, noble ambiance still seems to float in the air. What we see now, though, owes much to Italian restorations during the 1930s.

Our ship will cruise to Cyprus overnight.

Description.Title: RHODES
Description.Text:
In the morning, join us for a visit to ancient and medieval Rhodes. Our first stop will be Monte Smith and its splendid panoramic view of the island and the surrounding seascapes.

Our ship will cruise to Cyprus overnight.

Description.Title: LIMASSOL
Description.Text:
We’ll spend the morning cruising.

After lunch, join us for a tour of the archaeological ruins in Paphos, classified as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. We'll visit the impressive, underground tombs dating back to the 4th century BC that sport a distinct Egyptian influence. The remains of villas, palaces, theaters, fortresses, and tombs mean that the site is of exceptional architectural and historical value. We’ll continue to the coastal town of Yeroskipou to visit a Loukoum (Turkish Delight) factory, including a tasting.

After our tour, we’ll return on board and begin to cruise to Larnaca.

Description.Title: LIMASSOL

Description.Title: Highlights
Description.Text:
CRUISE HIGHLIGHTS

  • Cruise through the heavenly Cyclades in the Aegean Sea
  • ALL EXCURSIONS ARE INCLUDED
    • Athens and the Acropolis
    • Cape Sounion and the Apollo Coast
    • Delos, the mythical birthplace of Apollo
    • Mykonos, the apex of Grecian island culture
    • The legendary island of Santorini
    • Rhodes and its medieval knights
    • Paphos and its mosaics
  • Traditional Greek-style evening on board

Description.Title: This offer includes
Description.Text: Your cruise with all meals from dinner the first evening to breakfast on the final day - all onboard beverages (not including the special lists) - accommodations in a double-occupancy, climate-controlled cabin with shower in private bathroom - onboard entertainment - excursions mentioned in program - welcome cocktail - gala evening - assistance from our onboard, multi-lingual host/hostess -  emergency/repatriation insurance - all port fees.

Description.Title: This offer does not include
Description.Text: Transfers to/from departure/arrival points - drinks from our special wine list or drinks ordered during excursions or transfers - cancellation and baggage insurance - personal expenses.

Description.Title: Route
Description.Text: ATHENS - DELOS - MYKONOS - SANTORINI - RHODES - LIMASSOL - LARNACA

Description.Title: MONTREAL
Description.Text: Passengers are welcome to board our ship at 6:00 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we’ll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. We’ll enjoy dinner on board. The rest of the evening is yours to do as you please.

Description.Title: MONTREAL
Description.Text: Passengers are welcome to board our ship at 6:00 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we’ll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. We’ll enjoy dinner on board. The rest of the evening is yours to do as you please.

Description.Title: MONTREAL
Description.Text:
Join us for a guided tour of Montreal this morning to see the city’s musts and get a feel for its outstanding diversity. In Old Montreal, we’ll see Saint-Paul Street, Place Jacques-Cartier, and the outside of the Notre-Dame Basilica.

In the afternoon, we’ll set off on a panoramic visit and guided tour of the sophisticated city for a different view. We’ll drive along Saint Catherine Street—considered the main cultural and commerce artery in the downtown area—prestigious Sherbrooke Street, and through laid-back Plateau-Mont-Royal. We’ll have a tasting of some Montreal-style smoked meat before spending some free time in the Jean Talon farmer’s market—one of the oldest public markets in the city, situated in the heart of Little Italy. After we return on board, our ship will begin to cruise.

Description.Title: MONTREAL
Description.Text:
Join us for a guided tour of Montreal this morning to see the city’s musts and get a feel for its outstanding diversity. In Old Montreal, we’ll see Saint-Paul Street, Place Jacques-Cartier, and the outside of the Notre-Dame Basilica.

In the afternoon, we’ll set off on a panoramic visit and guided tour of the sophisticated city for a different view. We’ll drive along Saint Catherine Street—considered the main cultural and commerce artery in the downtown area—prestigious Sherbrooke Street, and through laid-back Plateau-Mont-Royal. We’ll have a tasting of some Montreal-style smoked meat before spending some free time in the Jean Talon farmer’s market—one of the oldest public markets in the city, situated in the heart of Little Italy. After we return on board, our ship will begin to cruise.

Description.Title: QUEBEC CITY
Description.Text:
We’ll arrive in Quebec City at the beginning of the morning. Join us for a tour of Old Quebec City. Cobblestone streets, charming boutiques, and the emblematic Château Frontenac await us! We'll visit Old Quebec on foot, stopping off at Dufferin Terrace to take in the spellbinding views of the river and castle before heading over to the fairytale-like Petit-Champlain neighborhood.

In the afternoon, join us for an excursion to the Île d’Orléans, where farming is active year round. We’ll set off on a countryside stroll that includes a bite of some local, tasty products. The island was one of the first French colonies, and a large percent of French Canadians can trace their heritage back to the Île d’Orléans. Although fishing and boat construction have been abandoned here, its rich history and gorgeous scenery make it one of the top tourist spots in the region. We’ll also stop off at Montmorency Falls and take in a spectacular view of the crashing waters. This evening, our ship will begin to cruise to Saguenay. Our ship will cruise through the night.

We’ll also stop off at Montmorency Falls and take in a spectacular view of the crashing waters. This evening, our ship will begin to cruise to Saguenay. Our ship will cruise through the night.

Description.Title: SAGUENAY
Description.Text: We’ll spend the morning cruising the Saguenay River. The Saguenay Fjord is home to an incredible array of wildlife and breathtaking scenery. Join us for an excursion to La Pulperie, a regional tourism center dedicated to the arts and history of the city of Chicoutimi. Set within an old paper mill, the museum highlights how paper manufacturing played a significant role in the development of the region at the beginning of the 20th century.

Description.Title: SAGUENAY
Description.Text: We’ll spend the morning cruising the Saguenay River. The Saguenay Fjord is home to an incredible array of wildlife and breathtaking scenery. Join us for an excursion to La Pulperie, a regional tourism center dedicated to the arts and history of the city of Chicoutimi. Set within an old paper mill, the museum highlights how paper manufacturing played a significant role in the development of the region at the beginning of the 20th century.

Description.Title: SAGUENAY - TADOUSSAC
Description.Text:
We’ll cruise back along the Saguenay River to reach the Saint Lawrence, arriving in Tadoussac at the end of the morning. Tadoussac is known worldwide for its beauty, scenery, and wildlife—whales, in particular! Located at the confluence of the two rivers, the colorful village only has 800 residents but is a major tourist destination nonetheless.

Thar she blows! Take advantage of our whale watch and climb aboard a local boat to catch a glimpse of some of the most elegant mammals in the world. If you have never been on a whale watch before, this is the chance to live a truly unforgettable experience.

Description.Title: SAGUENAY - TADOUSSAC
Description.Text:
We’ll cruise back along the Saguenay River to reach the Saint Lawrence, arriving in Tadoussac at the end of the morning. Tadoussac is known worldwide for its beauty, scenery, and wildlife—whales, in particular! Located at the confluence of the two rivers, the colorful village only has 800 residents but is a major tourist destination nonetheless.

Thar she blows! Take advantage of our whale watch and climb aboard a local boat to catch a glimpse of some of the most elegant mammals in the world. If you have never been on a whale watch before, this is the chance to live a truly unforgettable experience.

Description.Title: BAIE-COMEAU
Description.Text: Join us for an excursion to the Garden of the Glaciers and the Village Forestier d’Antan. The Garden of Glaciers is a giant leap back in time for an encounter with the last Ice Age. The multi-sensory experience tells the fascinating story of the dramatic climate changes that have affected our earth, the migration of the first people to set foot in North America, and the ancient Goldthwait Sea. We’ll also take in the views at the St-Pancrace Fjard Lookout. Our next stop will be the lumberjack village in Franquelin, where we’ll tour rustic log cabins and see the everyday items from the pioneer times. After our tour, we’ll return on board the ship. Our ship will begin to cruise to Gaspé.

Description.Title: BAIE-COMEAU
Description.Text: Join us for an excursion to the Garden of the Glaciers and the Village Forestier d’Antan. The Garden of Glaciers is a giant leap back in time for an encounter with the last Ice Age. The multi-sensory experience tells the fascinating story of the dramatic climate changes that have affected our earth, the migration of the first people to set foot in North America, and the ancient Goldthwait Sea. Our ship will begin to cruise to Gaspé.

Description.Title: GASPÉ
Description.Text: We’ll arrive in Gaspé at the beginning of the morning. Located at the tip of the Gaspé Peninsula, this is the location where Jacques Cartier took possession of New France in the name of King Francis I. We’ll set out on an excursion to Percé, the small city that sits directly across from the impressive sheer rock formation known as Percé Rock. We’ll take a boat tour around the beautiful, red-hued rock and continue to Bonaventure Island, a bird sanctuary containing the largest gannet population in North America during the summer months. Enjoy a stroll along one of the paths during our stay on the island. Afterwards, we’ll return on board our ship and begin to cruise to the legendary Magdalen Islands.

Description.Title: GASPÉ
Description.Text: We’ll arrive in Gaspé at the beginning of the morning. We’ll set out on an excursion to Percé, the small city that sits directly across from the impressive sheer rock formation known as Percé Rock. Description.Title: MAGDALEN ISLANDS - CAP-AUX-MEULES
Description.Text: The Magdalen Islands are a breathtakingly beautiful enclave in the middle of the Saint Lawrence River. Our ship will reach Cap-aux-Meules in the early morning. Cap-aux-Meules is known as the gateway to the archipelago. Join us for a tour of the island, beginning with the gorgeous scenery from the Hérissé Cape lighthouse and then moving on to historical Grave and the Fumoir d’Antan smokehouse, product shop, and Economuseum®. After we return on board, we’ll begin to cruise to Saint Pierre.

Description.Title: MAGDALEN ISLANDS - CAP-AUX-MEULES
Description.Text: The Magdalen Islands are a breathtakingly beautiful enclave in the middle of the Saint Lawrence River. Our ship will reach Cap-aux-Meules in the early morning. Join us for a tour of the island, beginning with the gorgeous scenery from the Hérissé Cape lighthouse and then moving on to historical Grave and the Fumoir d’Antan smokehouse, product shop, and Economuseum®. After we return on board, we’ll begin to cruise to Saint Pierre.

Description.Title: SAINT PIERRE
Description.Text: We’ll arrive in Saint Pierre in the afternoon. Located at the mouth of the Gulf of Saint Lawrence, Saint Pierre and Miquelon is a slice of France in North America. Although there is evidence of prehistoric settlements on the islands, there were no native inhabitants when the Europeans began exploring the New World, and these islands were not spared the constant French and English battles from the 17th to 19th centuries. The French finally claimed victory in 1815, and French fishermen once again took up residence and created a prosperous market. Saint Pierre itself is a living postcard. Join us for a tour of L'Île-aux-Marins. We’ll take a tour boat for a guided visit of the wind- and water-ravaged island(1). Although it once had a population of 700, there are currently no permanent residents. Time stands still at the abandoned settlement—a ghost town that includes a church, cemetery, school, and homes. Tonight is our festive gala evening.

On arrival, you’ll be transferred to your four-star hotel for check-in and dinner.

Description.Text: Cruise the Saint Lawrence River and visit the vibrant cities, vast expanses of nature, and quaint islands found in and around its waters.

Description.Title: Highlights
Description.Text:
CRUISE HIGHLIGHTS

  • Exclusive itinerary
  • New cruise on the Saint Lawrence River to Montreal and the rustic Saguenay Fjord
  • Luxurious, reasonably scaled vessel with dedicated crew
  • 3 excursions included: Saint Pierre and the Arche Museum and Archives, Old Quebec City, and the historical center of Montreal
  • EXCURSIONS INCLUDED:
    • Tours of Quebec City and Montreal
    • The brightly colored architecture in Saint Pierre and Miquelon
    • Learn about Canada from its founding to modern times
    • Tastings of local products
    • Discover the northern gannet bird colony on Bonaventure Island
    • Whale watch in Tadoussac
    • Beautiful landscapes on the Magdalen Islands

Description.Title: Requirements
Description.Text: Valid passport and eTA are mandatory. Non-EU nationals are advised to consult their embassy or consulate.

Description.Title: Additional information
Description.Text:
INTERNET

SATELLITE CONNECTIONS

Our ship provides Internet connection via satellite while we cruise, which is different and slower than what we are used to through our regular home or office services. We cannot guarantee connection at all times. Please keep this in mind while you are enjoying your vacation with us.

TELEPHONE SERVICE

DURING CRUISE

When we are at sea, you can connect your device(s) to the onboard GSM/3G network. Your service provider will automatically send you the terms and conditions of use for this service. You will be able to make calls, send messages, or use the Internet through this network’s roaming services. The GSM network will be turned off once the ship enters a port.

WHILE IN PORT

When the ship is in a port, you will be able to receive and make calls via your international calling/service plan according to the country you are visiting.

WATCH OUT FOR SERVICE FEES

We strongly recommend that you contact your service provider before your departure; international calls and data usage can be very costly and are almost never included in basic operator packages.

PLEASE CHECK THE SETTINGS FOR YOUR DEVICE

Once you are on board, but before you connect to the Internet, please check the settings for your device(s).  We request that you limit the downloading of videos and large-volume files. Automatic updates to your PC, tablet, and smartphones will affect the speed and cost of your connection. You probably have automatic updates for apps on your devices that you are not aware of. We recommend that you deactivate these updates while you are staying with us.

Description.Title: Useful information
Description.Text:
REQUIREMENTS

Please consult the competent authorities (consulate/embassy) before the trip.

CHILDREN TRAVELING WITH ONE PARENT OR A GUARDIAN

The parent or guardian must have the child’s birth certificate and a consent letter, written in English or French, that is signed by the absent parent. The consent letter must provide the contact information for the absent parent. The letter does not need to be certified. Attach a copy of the family record book (if it exists) and a copy of the absent parent’s ID card or passport showing their signature. If the parents are separated or divorced and if the traveling parent has sole custody, the traveling parent must have a copy of the custody order with them. If one of the parents is deceased, the traveling parent must have a copy of the death certificate with them. If the child has been adopted or is under guardianship, the parent(s) or guardian(s) must have a copy of the adoption papers or guardianship appointment with them.

PRECAUTIONS

No mandatory vaccines.

CURRENCY EXCHANGE

For the current exchange rates for the Canadian dollar, please consult websites such as www.xe.com or https://www1.oanda.com/currency/converter/.

Credit/debit cards: Visa and MasterCard are widely accepted.

There is no currency exchange service on board.

WEATHER

Canada has a humid continental climate with temperatures differentiating greatly between seasons. Harsh, snowy winters with temperatures falling into negative numbers contrast greatly with hot, humid summers that can reach temperatures over 86° F (30° C) in the summer.

The weather tends to be warm to hot from June to October. Evenings can be cool.

The autumn colors are renowned worldwide.

TIME DIFFERENCE

You can consult www.worldtimezone.com to see the time difference between your home and your destination.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

Tips have not been included for any of our excursions, so please be prepared to tip.

Keep in mind that all prices displayed during our excursions in Canada (in stores, at museums, etc.) do not include sales tax. Canada adds at least one sales tax to purchases, and these taxes can add as much as 15% to your total bill.

Tipping waiters and waitresses in restaurants and bars is absolutely expected. Add an additional 15% minimum to your final bill.

Smoking is strictly prohibited in public spaces in Canada.

Description.Title: Montreal - SAINT PIERRE
Description.Text: You’ll be transferred to the airport for a flight to Saint Pierre.(2) On arrival, we set out on a guided tour of Saint Pierre and the Arche Museum and Archives. Located at the mouth of the Gulf of Saint Lawrence, Saint Pierre and Miquelon is a slice of France in North America. Although there is evidence of prehistoric settlements on the islands, there were no native inhabitants when the Europeans began exploring the New World, and these islands were not spared the constant French and English battles from the 17th to 19th centuries. The French finally claimed victory in 1815, and French fishermen once again took up residence and created a prosperous market. Saint Pierre itself is a living postcard. During this tour, you’ll explore the museum and discover the history and stories of the archipelago through remembrances of the past. Later, we will board our ship at 6 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we’ll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail and enjoy dinner on board.

Time stands still at the abandoned settlement—a ghost town that includes a church, cemetery, school, and homes. Everyday objects and vintage photos found in the old school and several of the homes recount island life. After our tour, we’ll return to our ship and begin to cruise towards the Magdalen Islands and Cap-aux-Meules.

Description.Title: BAIE-COMEAU
Description.Text: Our ship will cruise alongside the Gaspé Peninsula this morning, before reaching Baie-Comeau at the beginning of the afternoon. Join us for an excursion to the Garden of the Glaciers and the Village Forestier d’Antan. The Garden of Glaciers is a giant leap back in time for an encounter with the last Ice Age. The multi-sensory experience tells the fascinating story of the dramatic climate changes that have affected our earth, the migration of the first people to set foot in North America, and the ancient Goldthwait Sea. We’ll also take in the views at the St-Pancrace Fjard Lookout. Our next stop will be the lumberjack village in Franquelin, where we’ll tour rustic log cabins and see the everyday items from the pioneer times. After our tour, we’ll return on board the ship and begin to cruise to Tadoussac.

Description.Title: TADOUSSAC - SAGUENAY
Description.Text:
We’ll arrive in Tadoussac early in the morning. Tadoussac is known worldwide for its beauty, scenery, and wildlife—whales, in particular! Located at the confluence of the two rivers, the colorful village only has 800 residents but is a major tourist destination nonetheless.

Thar she blows! Take advantage of our whale watch and climb aboard a local boat to catch a glimpse of some of the most elegant mammals in the world. If you have never been on a whale watch before, this is the chance to live a truly unforgettable experience. After we return on board, we’ll begin to cruise on the Saguenay River. The Saguenay Fjord is home to an incredible array of wildlife and breathtaking scenery. Our ship will remain in port overnight.

Description.Title: SAGUENAY
Description.Text: Join us for an excursion to La Pulperie, a regional tourism center dedicated to the arts and history of the city of Chicoutimi. Set within an old paper mill, the museum highlights how paper manufacturing played a significant role in the development of the region at the beginning of the 20th century. We’ll cruise back along the Saguenay River to reach the Saint Lawrence, and our ship will cruise through the night.

Description.Title: SAGUENAY
Description.Text: Join us for an excursion to La Pulperie, a regional tourism center dedicated to the arts and history of the city of Chicoutimi. Description.Title: QUEBEC CITY
Description.Text:
We’ll arrive in Quebec City early in the morning. Join us for a tour of Old Quebec City. Cobblestone streets, charming boutiques, and the emblematic Château Frontenac await us! We'll visit Old Quebec on foot, stopping off at Dufferin Terrace to take in the spellbinding views of the river and castle before heading over to the fairytale-like Petit-Champlain neighborhood.

In the afternoon, join us for an excursion to the Île d’Orléans, where farming is active year round. We’ll set off on a countryside stroll that includes a bite of some local, tasty products. The island was one of the first French colonies, and a large percent of French Canadians can trace their heritage back to the Île d’Orléans. Although fishing and boat construction have been abandoned here, its rich history and gorgeous scenery make it one of the top tourist spots in the region. We’ll also stop off at Montmorency Falls and take in a spectacular view of the crashing waters. This evening, our ship will begin to cruise to Montreal.

Description.Title: MONTREAL
Description.Text:
We’ll arrive in Montreal early in the morning. Join us for a guided tour of Montreal this morning to see the city’s musts and get a feel for its outstanding diversity. In Old Montreal, we’ll see Saint-Paul Street, Place Jacques-Cartier, and the outside of the Notre-Dame Basilica.

In the afternoon, we’ll set off on a panoramic visit and guided tour of this sophisticated city for a different view. We’ll drive along Saint Catherine Street—considered the main cultural and commerce artery in the downtown area—prestigious Sherbrooke Street, and through laid-back Plateau-Mont-Royal. We’ll have a tasting of some Montreal-style smoked meat before spending some free time in the Jean Talon farmer’s market—one of the oldest public markets in the city, situated in the heart of Little Italy. After our tour, we’ll return on board the ship. Tonight, we’ll enjoy our gala evening.

Description.Title: MONTREAL
Description.Text: Enjoy breakfast on board this morning before disembarking.

Description.Title: MONTREAL
Description.Text: Enjoy breakfast on board this morning before disembarking.
Cruising Canada on the Saint Lawrence River from Saint Pierre and Miquelon to Montreal

Description.Title: Our strengths
Description.Text: Cruise the Saint Lawrence River and visit the vibrant cities, vast expanses of nature, and quaint islands found in and around its waters.

Description.Title: Highlights
Description.Text:
CRUISE HIGHLIGHTS

  • Exclusive itinerary
  • New cruise on the Saint Lawrence River to Montreal and the rustic Saguenay Fjord
  • Luxurious, reasonably scaled vessel with dedicated crew
  • 3 excursions included: Saint Pierre and the Arche Museum and Archives, Old Quebec City, and the historical center of Montreal
  • EXCURSIONS INCLUDED:
    • Tours of Quebec City and Montreal
    • The brightly colored architecture in Saint Pierre and Miquelon
    • Learn about Canada from its founding to modern times
    • Tastings of local products
    • Discover the northern gannet bird colony on Bonaventure Island
    • Whale watch in Tadoussac
    • Beautiful landscapes on the Magdalen Islands

Description.Title: This offer includes
Description.Text: Flight between Montreal and Saint Pierre, including airport taxes (2019 rate: €20)(2) - transfers between hotel and airport in Montreal and the airport and port in Saint Pierre - your cruise in the cabin category of your choice - all meals - drinks with your meals and at the onboard bar (not including our special wine and drinks list) - excursions mentioned in the program - one night at a four-star hotel in Montreal, including dinner and breakfast - lunch on Day 2 and the guided tour of Saint Pierre - guided tour of Old Quebec City on Day 9 - guided tour of Montreal on Day 10 - emergency/repatriation insurance - all port fees and vessel agent charges.

Description.Title: This offer does not include
Description.Text: Drinks from our special lists or drinks ordered during excursions or transfers - eTA (electronic travel authorization) - cancellation and baggage insurance -  transfers/travel to and from departure/arrival points - tips.

Description.Title: Itinéraire
Description.Text: Montreal - SAINT PIERRE - CAP-AUX-MEULES - GASPÉ - BAIE-COMEAU - TADOUSSAC - QUEBEC CITY - MONTREAL

Description.Title: THE CROISIEUROPE DIFFERENCE
Description.Text:
THE CROISIEUROPE DIFFERENCE

  • All meals included - DRINKS INCLUDED with meals
  • Refined local cuisine
  • Headsets are included for excursions
  • Official welcome from the captain and crew
  • Tour leader or cruise director on board
  • Onboard activities and/or lectures
  • Travel assistance and repatriation insurance
  • All port fees included

Description.Title: Transport
Description.Text:
Port-to-port cruise, without transfer. 

For more information about flights and transfers, please contact our call center by clicking on « Request a quote » and filling out the form, or by calling 1-800-768-7232

Description.Title: Requirements
Description.Text: Valid passport required. Non-EU nationals are advised to consult their embassy or consulate.

Description.Title: Additional information
Description.Text:
INTERNET

SATELLITE CONNECTIONS

Our ship provides Internet connection via satellite while we cruise, which is different and slower than what we are used to through our regular home or office services. We cannot guarantee connection at all times. Please keep this in mind while you are enjoying your vacation with us.

TELEPHONE SERVICE

DURING CRUISE

When we are at sea, you can connect your device(s) to the onboard GSM/3G network. Your service provider will automatically send you the terms and conditions of use for this service. You will be able to make calls, send messages, or use the Internet through this network’s roaming services. The GSM network will be turned off once the ship enters a port.

WHILE IN PORT

When the ship is in a port, you will be able to receive and make calls via your international calling/service plan according to the country you are visiting.

WATCH OUT FOR SERVICE FEES

We strongly recommend that you contact your service provider before your departure; international calls and data usage can be very costly and are almost never included in basic operator packages.

PLEASE CHECK THE SETTINGS FOR YOUR DEVICE

Once you are on board, but before you connect to the Internet, please check the settings for your device(s).  We request that you limit the downloading of videos and large-volume files. Automatic updates to your PC, tablet, and smartphones will affect the speed and cost of your connection. You probably have automatic updates for apps on your devices that you are not aware of. We recommend that you deactivate these updates while you are staying with us.

Description.Title: Useful information
Description.Text:
Requirements

Please consult the competent authorities (consulate/embassy) before the trip.

Children traveling with one parent or a guardian. The parent or guardian must have the child’s birth certificate and a consent letter, written in English or French, that is signed by the absent parent. The consent letter must provide the contact information for the absent parent. The letter does not need to be certified. Attach a copy of the family record book (if it exists) and a copy of the absent parent’s ID card or passport showing their signature. If the parents are separated or divorced and if the traveling parent has sole custody, the traveling parent must have a copy of the custody order with them. If one of the parents is deceased, the traveling parent must have a copy of the death certificate with them. If the child has been adopted or is under guardianship, the parent(s) or guardian(s) must have a copy of the adoption papers or guardianship appointment with them.

Precautions

No mandatory vaccines.

Currency exchange

For the current exchange rates for the Canadian dollar, please consult websites such as www.xe.com or https://www1.oanda.com/currency/converter/.

Credit/debit cards: Visa and MasterCard are widely accepted.

There is no currency exchange service on board.

Weather

Canada has a humid continental climate with temperatures differentiating greatly between seasons. Harsh, snowy winters with temperatures falling into negative numbers contrast greatly with hot, humid summers that can reach temperatures over 86° F (30° C) in the summer.

The weather tends to be warm to hot from June to October. Evenings can be cool.

The autumn colors are renowned worldwide.

Time difference

You can consult www.worldtimezone.com to see the time difference between your home and your destination.

Additional information:

2020 pre-cruise program subject to change

• The excursions can be modified and the order of the visits can be reversed if necessary.

• The captain of the ship is the sole authority who can modify the ship itinerary for safety or navigational reasons.

• Tips have not been included for any of our excursions, so please be prepared to tip.

• Keep in mind that all prices displayed during our excursions in Canada (in stores, at museums, etc.) do not include sales tax. Canada adds at least one sales tax to purchases, and these taxes can add as much as 15% to your total bill.

• Tipping waiters and waitresses in restaurants and bars is absolutely expected. Add an additional 15% minimum to your final bill.

• Smoking is strictly prohibited in public spaces in Canada.

Description.Title: Mentions
Description.Text:
Warning: Navigational obligations and weather conditions can disrupt the itinerary, and in certain cases, intermediate stops may be canceled. If this happens, CroisiEurope will do our best to find the best solution according to passenger expectations. For safety reasons, the company and/or the captain of the ship are the only authorities who can modify the cruise itinerary.

2019 PRE-CRUISE PROGRAM (subject to changes).

(1) Subject to favorable weather conditions; limited availability

(2) Flight between Montreal and Saint Pierre. Flight schedules are not currently available. These flights may give rise to stop on the outbound and/or inbound journeys. Airport taxes (2019 rate: €20). We will inform you of the airline you will fly on at least three months before your departure.

Alcohol can be dangerous to your health. Please drink in moderation.

Valid information for year 2020

Description.Text:
• 20% reduction for 1 child from the age of 2 up to the age of 10 sharing a cabin with 1 adult (on the price of the cruise only - excluding flights, taxes, supplements and service fees)
  • 30% reduction for 1 child from the age of 2 up to the age of 10 sharing a cabin with 2 adults (on the price of the cruise only - excluding flights, taxes, supplements and service fees)

Description.Title: POINTE-A-PITRE (Guadeloupe)
Description.Text: You are welcome to board our ship at 6 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we’ll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. Tonight we’ll enjoy dinner and an evening of activities on board.

Description.Title: POINTE-A-PITRE (Guadeloupe)
Description.Text: You are welcome to board our ship at 6 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we’ll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. Tonight we’ll enjoy dinner and an evening of activities on board.

Description.Title: POINTE-A-PITRE
Description.Text:
Guadeloupe is one of the major destinations in the Antilles. The archipelago consists of six inhabited islands, including Les Saintes, Marie-Galante, and La Désirade.

This morning, set out on an included excursion to Grande-Terre Island. The tranquil, white sandy beaches of Grand-Terre await you. You’ll discover many of its colorful villages, including Morne-à-l’Eau and its beautiful black-and-white tiled cemetary. You’ll also visit the Zevallos Colonial Estate, one of the last colonial-style homes on the island. Brandishing fine and elegant ironwork, slender metal structures, a pink terracotta roof, and a first-floor loggia, the house was created in Gustave Eiffel’s workshop. We’ll learn about the history of enslaved people and sugar cane production, and we’ll stop for a great photo op at the rocky peninsula of Pointe des Châteaux. At the end of our excursion, enjoy a stroll through the fragrant market in Sainte-Anne.

In the afternoon, we’ll set out on a trip to Basse-Terre. Basse-Terre, covered with soaring summits and thick rainforests, is by far the most breathtaking of all the islands in Guadeloupe. After a stroll on a lushly lined path that follows the Corossol River, we’ll find the idyllic jungle waterfall, the Cascade aux Ecrevisses. We’ll then head over to the Valombreuse Floral Park. Tucked away between the peaks and the coastline, the park offers the ideal opportunity to enjoy the wide variety of plants and trees found across the island, as well as 28 species of birds.

Our ship will cruise to Saint Lucia overnight.

Our ship will cruise to Saint Lucia overnight.

Description.Title: SOUFRIERE (Saint Lucia)
Description.Text:
Located south of Martinique and north of Saint Vincent and the Grenadines, Saint Lucia is part of the Windward Islands. It’s obvious to anyone who has visited that Saint Lucia has been blessed by nature. The island’s twin volcanic peaks overlook a variety of landscapes surrounded by white sandy beaches and pristine water.

This morning, we’ll set off on an included excursion to visit Sulphur Springs Park. Sulphur Springs Park is the “only drive-in volcano” in the world as you are able to travel right into the core of the dormant volcano. A walk through the crater brings you to bubbling hot springs and warm sulphuric pools. After, we’ll visit the Morne Coubaril Historical Adventure Park to learn about the history of the plantation’s cocoa and coffee bean production. Located on the western part of the island, the adventure park has a working mill and authentic huts that give a glimpse into the estate’s past.

This afternoon, we’ll set out on an excursion to Diamond Falls Botanical Garden and the Tet Paul Nature Trail (please wear comfortable, sturdy walking shoes and the appropriate clothing). Join us for an unforgettable afternoon experiencing what nature on the island has to offer.   Our first stop will be the kaleidoscope of colors found at Diamond Falls, one of the natural wonders on Saint Lucia. The falls are located in a peaceful botanical garden with a diverse range of tropical flowers and vegetation.  We’ll continue our excursion on the Tet Paul Nature Trail, a short hike through medicinal plants and exotic fruit trees that culminates in spectacular views of the water and mountains. To top off the excursion, we’ll head to one of the black sand beaches under the Petit Piton peak to enjoy some local fruit juice.

OR Enjoy some free time on your own and hit the beach!

Our ship will cruise to Union Island overnight.

Description.Title: UNION ISLAND (The Grenadines)
Description.Text:
Saint Vincent and the Grenadines is a calm and peaceful haven of islands in the heart of the Caribbean Sea. The casual and friendly atmosphere, as well as the unspoiled natural wonders, make the islands a top destination for those who want to get away from it all.

One of today’s adventures can be a full-day excursion to Tobagos Cays. We’ll set out on catamarans for the small group of islands, the Tobagos Cays, known as the Jewels of the Caribbean. You will find no match to the beauty found within the Tobagos Cays. The diving and snorkeling are second to none, and those just needing to relax on the beach can do so to the sounds of nature around them. Come discover the fine corals reefs and crystal clear lagoons harboring sea turtles and colorful fish. We’ll enjoy a lobster bake lunch on one of the islands and spend an unforgettable afternoon at the beaches on Morpion Island, a tiny, uninhabited isle with white sand and coconut palms.(1)

OR

Spend the morning exploring the Tobago Cays on an outing (places are limited). Climb aboard a catamaran and head to the suburb Tobago Cays to discover the fine corals reefs and crystal-clear lagoons harboring sea turtles and colorful fish, and take a dip in the sea during a stop in one of the calm crags.(2)

You’ll have lunch on our cruise ship and then have the afternoon free. You can spend some time shopping or having a swim on shore in the small village of Union.

Our ship will cruise to Fort-de-France overnight.

Description.Title: FORT-DE-FRANCE (Martinique)
Description.Text:
When visiting Martinique, you’ll understand why it’s known as the “Island of Flowers.” The northern part of the island is a tropical forest, and the southern part has white sandy beaches, palm trees, and warm waters. And yet, the dark history of colonialism and slavery has also left its mark on this modern paradise.

This morning, join us for an included tour of Fort-de-France. Flamands Bay is the center of Creole history on the island. We’ll visit  Fort Saint Louis—the stronghold built in the 17th century to protect the island—St. Louis Cathedral, and the Schœlcher public library. Originally built for the Exposition Universelle of 1889 (alongside the Eiffel Tower), the library building was dismantled, shipped to Martinique, and reassembled piece by piece.

Feel free to join us this afternoon on the included excursion: “A Place of Memory and History.” We’ll visit the Savane des Esclaves, where we’ll learn about 400 years of Martinique’s history, specifically the accounts of the lives of enslaved people on the plantation. An islander began to build this open-air museum in 1999 with the aim of handing down the authentic stories and events of the somber past. After, we’ll head to the Atlantic coastline to tour the Clément Estate, where the world-famous Rhum Clément is made. The magnificent main house, an exceptional example of Creole architecture, is surrounded by a lovely park.    At the end of our tour, you’ll enjoy a tasting.

Our ship will cruise to Les Saintes overnight.

Our ship will cruise to Les Saintes overnight.

Description.Title: LES SAINTES (Guadeloupe)
Description.Text:
Les Saintes is an archipelago of nine islands that have remained rather isolated over the centuries, adding to their unique character. Charming villages, excellent restaurants, intriguing galleries,  superb beaches, and gorgeous bays are just a few delights found on the islands.

Once we arrive in Terre-de-Haut, you’ll be on your own to explore Guadeloupe’s most cosmopolitan island. Discover its small fishing harbor, multi-colored homes, and the majestic Fort Napoléon while also walking through the island’s natural wonders. Don’t forget to have a bite of the local culinary delight: Tourment d’amour pastries.

In the afternoon, join us at the pool bar for a cocktail-mixing demonstration!

Our ship will cruise to Saint Barts overnight.

Description.Title: GUSTAVIA (Saint Barthelemy)
Description.Text:
Saint Barts was named by Christopher Columbus in honor of his brother. Today, it’s the hottest Caribbean getaway for the jet set. You’ll see why once you get a glimpse of its beautiful coastlines of beaches. Gustavia, its capital, gives off a French flair. Saint Barts is a showcase of pristine tropical beaches and chic lifestyles.

Join us for a tour of the island this morning (included). We’ll visit Saint Barthelemy, more commonly known as Saint Barts, where the stars go to get away from it all. Our tour will include charming Gustavia, the gorgeous beaches on the island, legendary ballet dancer Rudolf Nureyev’s former home, and Lorient, with its blossoming graveyards. It will also include stops at breathtaking overlooks to get a real feel of the diversity of the landscape.

Spend the afternoon poolside on the ship or enjoy a stroll through the island’s capital, Gustavia, a colorful, charming, posh town.

Our ship will cruise to Marie-Galante overnight.

Description.Title: GUSTAVIA (Saint Barthelemy)
Description.Text:
Saint Barts was named by Christopher Columbus in honor of his brother. Today, it’s the hottest Caribbean getaway for the jet set. You’ll see why once you get a glimpse of its beautiful coastlines of beaches. Gustavia, its capital, gives off a French flair. Saint Barts is a showcase of pristine tropical beaches and chic lifestyles.

Join us for a tour of the island this morning (included). We’ll visit Saint Barthelemy, more commonly known as Saint Barts, where the stars go to get away from it all. Our tour will include charming Gustavia, the gorgeous beaches on the island, legendary ballet dancer Rudolf Nureyev’s former home, and Lorient, with its blossoming graveyards. It will also include stops at breathtaking overlooks to get a real feel of the diversity of the landscape.

Spend the afternoon poolside on the ship or enjoy a stroll through the island’s capital, Gustavia, a colorful, charming, posh town.

Our ship will cruise to Marie-Galante overnight.

Description.Title: MARIE-GALANTE (Guadeloupe)
Description.Text:
We’ll spend the morning cruising to Marie-Galante.

Join us for some fun in the lounge and learn to dance the Merengue and Bachata.

Discover the laid-back lifestyle, simplicity, and deep heritage found on the lush, green island of Marie-Galante.

This afternoon, we’ll set out on an included excursion to Marie-Galante. We'll begin the tour in the charming commune of Grand-Bourg, whose streets are lined with Creole-style homes. We’ll then visit the Murat Plantation, one of the largest in Guadeloupe during the 19th century. Although the château was once the largest sugar cane plantation in the Guadeloupe Islands, today it houses the Museum of Arts and Popular Traditions. Tonight is our festive gala evening.

Our ship will cruise to Pointe-à-Pitre overnight.

Although the château was once the largest sugar cane plantation in the Guadeloupe Islands, today it houses the Museum of Arts and Popular Traditions. Tonight is our festive gala evening.

Description.Title: NICE
Description.Text: Passengers are welcome to board at 6:00 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we’ll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. Tonight, we’ll enjoy dinner and an evening of activities on board. Our ship will cruise to Corsica overnight.

Description.Title: AJACCIO - The Calanques de Piana
Description.Text: We’ll spend the morning cruising and the afternoon on an excursion to the Calanques de Piana. These sheer cliffs and rock sculptures seem to jet up from the water and radiate a red hue along the coastline. During our tour, we’ll also stop at one of the panoramic viewpoints to admire the amazing landscape.

Description.Title: AJACCIO - The Calanques de Piana
Description.Text: We’ll spend the morning cruising and the afternoon on an excursion to the Calanques de Piana. These sheer cliffs and rock sculptures seem to jet up from the water and radiate a red hue along the coastline. During our tour, we’ll also stop at one of the panoramic viewpoints to admire the amazing landscape.

Description.Title: AJACCIO
Description.Text:
Join us for an optional excursion this morning through the Corsican maquis. You’ll discover untamed Corsica and one of the most beautiful valleys in the region as you plunge into the heart of the Corsican maquis. We’ll also enjoy a tasting of local cheese and cold cuts.

This afternoon, we’ll set out on an excursion to Ajaccio and the Îles Sanguinaires. We’ll first follow Napoleon’s trail through the old city before visiting the captivating beauty found on the outlying islands.

Our ship will cruise to Bonifacio. Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: AJACCIO
Description.Text:
Join us for an optional excursion this morning through the Corsican maquis. You’ll discover untamed Corsica and one of the most beautiful valleys in the region as you plunge into the heart of the Corsican maquis. We’ll also enjoy a tasting of local cheese and cold cuts.

This afternoon, we’ll set out on an excursion to Ajaccio and the Îles Sanguinaires. We’ll first follow Napoleon’s trail through the old city before visiting the captivating beauty found on the outlying islands.

Our ship will cruise to Bonifacio. Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: BONIFACIO
Description.Text:
This morning, we’ll set out on a guided tour of Bonifacio. The city is rich with a history told among its small streets and paths, a thousand-year-old fortress, and the sturdy stone homes perched high above the sea waves. The descent (and subsequent ascent) of the King of Aragon’s Stairway will provide some of the best views on the trip (187 steps) .

Enjoy a free afternoon on your own or join us for an excursion to the nature reserve on the Archipelago of Lavezzi. The islands are scattered with sculpted granite boulders and have a network of clearly marked footpaths to take in all the views. We’ll return on board to cruise towards Porto Vecchio as we drift by nature reserves and splendid seascapes dotted with faraway islands. Join us for dinner and an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: BONIFACIO

Description.Title: PORTO VECCHIO
Description.Text:
In the morning, we’ll set out on a guided tour of Porto Vecchio. The old town includes the ruins of a 16th-century citadel and gorgeous views of the marina.

The afternoon will be spent cruising to Bastia. Feel free to take part in some of the onboard activities offered.

Description.Title: PORTO VECCHIO
Description.Text:
In the morning, we’ll set out on a guided tour of Porto Vecchio. The old town includes the ruins of a 16th-century citadel and gorgeous views of the marina.

The afternoon will be spent cruising to Bastia. Feel free to take part in some of the onboard activities offered.

Description.Title: BASTIA
Description.Text: Join us for an excursion to Cap Corse (including lunch).  Located to the north of Bastia and Saint-Florent, Cap Corse is a 25-mile long promontory with several attractive fishing villages, a gorgeous coastline, and a couple of good beaches. We’ll enjoy a tasting of local wine, cold-cuts, and cheese before returning on board to cruise towards L'Ile Rousse.

Description.Title: BASTIA
Description.Text: Join us for an excursion to Cap Corse (including lunch).  Located to the north of Bastia and Saint-Florent, Cap Corse is a 25-mile long promontory with several attractive fishing villages, a gorgeous coastline, and a couple of good beaches. We’ll enjoy a tasting of local wine, cold-cuts, and cheese before returning on board to cruise towards L'Ile Rousse.

Description.Title: L'ILE ROUSSE
Description.Text:
This morning, join us for a tour of Calvi and its citadel. You’ll discover its large marina and immense bay surrounded by its unique landscape and often snow-capped mountains. We’ll head toward Notre Dame de la Serra to get a magnificent view of the gulf. Our tour will continue at the citadel. The symbol of the town of Calvi, it was built during the Genoese occupation.

OR

Discover the old villages in the Balagne Region during an optional excursion.  These are the fertile hills of the island, commonly referred to as the Corsican gardens. We’ll travel through the region and visit a few of the more than thirty villages perched on cliffs or hidden in narrow valleys.

Take advantage of some downtime on our afternoon cruise towards Nice. Tonight is our festive gala evening.

Description.Title: Additional information
Description.Text:
INTERNET

SATELLITE CONNECTIONS

Our ship provides Internet connection via satellite while we cruise, which is different and slower than what we are used to through our regular home or office services. We cannot guarantee connection at all times. Please keep this in mind while you are enjoying your vacation with us.

TELEPHONE SERVICE

DURING CRUISE

When we are at sea, you can connect your device(s) to the onboard GSM/3G network. Your service provider will automatically send you the terms and conditions of use for this service. You will be able to make calls, send messages, or use the Internet through this network’s roaming services. The GSM network will be turned off once the ship enters a port.

WHILE IN PORT

When the ship is in a port, you will be able to receive and make calls via your international calling/service plan according to the country you are visiting.

WATCH OUT FOR SERVICE FEES

We strongly recommend that you contact your service provider before your departure; international calls and data usage can be very costly and are almost never included in basic operator packages.

PLEASE CHECK THE SETTINGS FOR YOUR DEVICE

Once you are on board, but before you connect to the Internet, please check the settings for your device(s).  We request that you limit the downloading of videos and large-volume files. Automatic updates to your PC, tablet, and smartphones will affect the speed and cost of your connection. You probably have automatic updates for apps on your devices that you are not aware of. We recommend that you deactivate these updates while you are staying with us.

Description.Title: NAPLES
Description.Text: Passengers are welcome to board our ship at 6:00 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we'll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. Dinner will be served on board, followed by an evening of entertainment in the lounge.

Description.Title: NAPLES
Description.Text: Passengers are welcome to board our ship at 6:00 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we'll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. Dinner will be served on board, followed by an evening of entertainment in the lounge.

Description.Title: NAPLES
Description.Text: We'll set out on a full-day excursion to Capri and Anacapri (1) (lunch included.) We'll take an airboat or a ferry to splendid Capri (depending on the crossing times.) We'll head to the village of Anacapri and visit the villa San Michele. Anacapri is located in the highest part of the island. From the villa gardens you'll have a fantastic view of the city of Capri, the Gulf of Naples and Mount Vesuvius. In the afternoon, enjoy some free time on your own or visit the Gardens of Augustus, offering splendid views of the sea and fantastic photographic vistas. We'll return to Naples by airboat or ferry. Tonight we'll enjoy songs and music from the Naples region.

Description.Title: NAPLES
Description.Text: We'll set out on a full-day excursion to Capri and Anacapri (1) (lunch included.) We'll take an airboat or a ferry to splendid Capri (depending on the crossing times.) We'll head to the village of Anacapri and visit the villa San Michele. Anacapri is located in the highest part of the island. From the villa gardens you'll have a fantastic view of the city of Capri, the Gulf of Naples and Mount Vesuvius. In the afternoon, enjoy some free time on your own or visit the Gardens of Augustus, offering splendid views of the sea and fantastic photographic vistas. We'll return to Naples by airboat or ferry. Tonight we'll enjoy songs and music from the Naples region.

Description.Title: NAPLES
Description.Text: Join us on a tour of Herculaneum. Destroyed by an earthquake in 62 AD, the subsequent eruption of Mount Vesuvius in 79 AD saw Herculaneum submerged in a sea of mud that essentially fossilized the city. After our tour, we'll return to the ship and spend the afternoon cruising to Civitavecchia. Enjoy dinner and an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: NAPLES
Description.Text: Join us on a tour of Herculaneum. Destroyed by an earthquake in 62 AD, the subsequent eruption of Mount Vesuvius in 79 AD saw Herculaneum submerged in a sea of mud that essentially fossilized the city. After our tour, we'll return to the ship and spend the afternoon cruising to Civitavecchia. Enjoy dinner and an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: CIVITAVECCHIA - ROME, the Eternal City
Description.Text: Join us for a full-day excursion to Rome, the "Eternal City¿ (lunch included.) You'll visit the exteriors of all the must-see sites of the Italian capital, including the Colosseum and the Roman Forum. On foot, you'll discover the grandiose Trevi Fountain, the Pantheon and the legendary Piazza Navona. After lunch, we'll visit Vatican City to admire St. Peter's Square and Basilica, regarded as one of the greatest buildings of its age. At the end of our tour, we'll return to the ship by coach. Our ship will cast off in the evening.

Description.Title: CIVITAVECCHIA - ROME, the Eternal City
Description.Text: Join us for a full-day excursion to Rome, the "Eternal City¿ (lunch included.) You'll visit the exteriors of all the must-see sites of the Italian capital, including the Colosseum and the Roman Forum. On foot, you'll discover the grandiose Trevi Fountain, the Pantheon and the legendary Piazza Navona. After lunch, we'll visit Vatican City to admire St. Peter's Square and Basilica, regarded as one of the greatest buildings of its age. At the end of our tour, we'll return to the ship by coach. Our ship will cast off in the evening.

Description.Title: PORTOFERRAIO - Elba - LIVORNO
Description.Text: We'll arrive in Elba early in the morning. Elba is the biggest island of the Tuscan Archipelago and the third largest in Italy after Sardinia and Sicily. We'll leave on a guided panoramic tour of the island to see the photogenic beaches at Biodola and Procchio. We'll also stop at Marciana Marina, a charming, small city whose old town is considered among the most beautiful in Italy. Enjoy some free time before we hit the road again for Chiessi, a small hamlet surrounded by granite cliffs, and Pomonte, famous for its white sand beaches. We'll then head to the small fishing village of Marina di Campo, one of the best known resorts on the island dominated by its tower. After our visit, you'll have some free time to sightsee on your own before heading back to the ship. We'll cast off for Livorno. After dinner, enjoy an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: PORTOFERRAIO - Elba - LIVORNO

Description.Title: LIVORNO - Florence - Pisa - LIVORNO
Description.Text: We'll set out on a full-day excursion to Florence and Pisa. Nestled among the exquisite Tuscan hills, Florence is one of the most beautiful cities in Italy. Join us for a guided tour of its magnificent center. We'll have lunch in a local restaurant. After lunch, we'll set off for Pisa, the city that dominated the western Mediterranean in the middle ages thanks to its powerful fleet. Take your time walking through the la Piazza dei Miracoli and enjoy the religious buildings (exteriors - entrance fees not included): the Pisa Cathedral, the Pisa Baptistery, the Campanile, and the Camposanto Monumentale. You'll also have time to see the Leaning Tower of Pisa. We'll return to the Port of Livorno and begin to cruise towards Monaco.

You'll also have time to see the Leaning Tower of Pisa. We'll return to the Port of Livorno and begin to cruise towards Monaco.

Description.Title: MONACO - NICE
Description.Text: We'll spend the morning cruising, before arriving in Monaco. We'll visit the legendary Rock of Monaco, a tall monolith surrounded by old quarter battlements in the heart of the City of Princes. At the end of the day, we'll set off towards Nice. Tonight is our festive gala evening.

You can also stroll in front of the famous monuments of Florence, one of the most beautiful cities in Italy, and Pisa.

Description.Title: CATANIA
Description.Text: Passengers are welcome to board our ship at 6 p.m. After comfortably settling into your cabins, we'll introduce our crew at a welcome cocktail. We'll enjoy dinner on board this evening. The rest of the evening is yours to do as you please.

Description.Title: CATANIA (SICILY)
Description.Text:
In the morning, join us for a tour of Catania. Located on the banks of the Ionian Sea and dominated by Mount Etna, you'll discover vast squares, wide streets, and lava rock buildings in this splendid city. Its historical and artistic heritage is just waiting to be discovered.

This afternoon, join us for an excursion to "The Cyclopean Coast," a fantastic mix of legends and history. Our first stop will be Aci Trezza, a small fishing village known for three tall, column-shaped islands right off its coast. In Homer's Odyssey, Cyclops Polyphemus hurled these large boulders at Ulysses' vessels. After a stroll through the seaside village, we'll head to Aci Castello. From a panoramic observation point, you'll be able to admire the lava rock castle perched above the sea. We'll then continue on to Acireale, an elegant baroque town at the foot of Mount Etna. You'll discover the historical heart of the town and its lava rock architecture. We'll also get to taste Sicilian pastries.

OR join us on an excursion to Mount Etna (lunch included).(1) We'll set out to visit one of the most famous volcanos in Europe. Century after century, the eruptions have modified the slopes of the mountain, forming unique sculptures of lava and ice. Our coach will climb the mountain to the Sapienza refuge, at about 6,234 feet high (1,900 m.). From there, we'll continue our ascent by aerial tram and then in a four-wheel drive bus to the "Tower of the Philosopher." From the ancient and monumental "Valle de Bove" caldera, you'll take in the superb view across the valley to the Mediterranean Sea.
Tonight's festivities will have a Sicilian flair!

Description.Title: CATANIA (SICILY)
Description.Text:
In the morning, join us for a tour of Catania. Located on the banks of the Ionian Sea and dominated by Mount Etna, you'll discover vast squares, wide streets, and lava rock buildings in this splendid city.

This afternoon, join us for an excursion to "The Cyclopean Coast," a fantastic mix of legends and history. Our first stop will be Aci Trezza, a small fishing village, before heading to Aci Castello. From a panoramic observation point, you'll be able to admire the lava rock castle perched above the sea. We'll then continue on to Acireale, an elegant baroque town at the foot of Mount Etna. We'll also get to taste Sicilian pastries.

OR join us on an excursion to Mount Etna (lunch included).(1) We'll set out to visit one of the most famous volcanos in Europe.

Tonight's festivities will have a Sicilian flair!

Description.Title: POZZALLO (SICILY)
Description.Text:
We'll spend the morning cruising.

Come with us on an optional excursion to Ragusa and Modica this afternoon. Travel back in time when visiting these lovely UNESCO World Heritage sites. In Ragusa, you'll discover two cities in one: modern Ragusa rebuilt after the 1693 earthquake and ancient Hybla Heraia. The city's architectural gem is the Duomo of San Giorgio (outsides only). We'll then continue on to Modica, a charming inland village snuggled on a hillside. Rebuilt after the 1693 earthquake, Modica is now a lively and dynamic city with over-sized churches and steep stairs running from the bottom of the village to the top of the slope. During our tour, we'll stop at a boutique to taste a chocolate recipe coming directly from the Aztecs.

We'll cruise through the night towards Malta.

Description.Title: POZZALLO (SICILY)
Description.Text:
We'll spend the morning cruising.

Come with us on an optional excursion to Ragusa and Modica this afternoon. Travel back in time when visiting these lovely UNESCO World Heritage sites.

We'll cruise through the night towards Malta.

Description.Title: VALLETTA (Malta)
Description.Text:
Join us for an included excursion to Gozo (lunch included). We'll set out on a full-day trip to a calm, heavenly oasis. We'll take the ferry from Cirkewwa to Gozo, admiring the gorgeous landscapes and scenery along the way, including the impressive, fortified citadel in the capital city of Rabat. You'll discover remains of the Azure Window, a 92-foot (28 m) limestone natural arch that collapsed completely in March 2017, as well as the bay of Xlendi. In the afternoon, we'll visit the megalithic temple complex of Ggantija, listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

Tonight's festivities will have a Maltese flair!

Description.Title: VALLETTA (Malta)
Description.Text:
Join us for an included excursion to Gozo (lunch included). We'll set out on a full-day trip to a calm, heavenly oasis. You'll discover remains of the Azure Window, a limestone natural arch that collapsed completely in March 2017, as well as the bay of Xlendi. We'll visit the megalithic temple complex of Ggantija, listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

Tonight's festivities will have a Maltese flair!

Description.Title: VALLETTA (Malta)
Description.Text:
In the morning, we'll set out on an excursion to discover some of Malta's archaeological treasures. We'll visit the Tarxien and Hagar Qim temple complexes dating back to the beginning of the Bronze Age. We'll then head to the Ghar Dalam cave, containing the bone remains of animals that were stranded and subsequently became extinct in Malta at the end of the Last Glacial Maximum.

This afternoon, join us for a tour of Valletta. The splendid Maltese capital deserves a special visit. Perched on top a steep cliff, its layout and architectural structures are remarkable. The city was built stone-by-stone by and for the Order of Knights of the Hospital of Saint John of Jerusalem. We'll make a special stop at Saint John's Co-Cathedral.

Description.Title: VALLETTA (Malta)
Description.Text:
In the morning, we'll set out on an excursion to discover some of Malta's archaeological treasures. We'll visit the Tarxien and Hagar Qim temple complexes and the Ghar Dalam cave.

This afternoon, join us for a tour of Valletta. The splendid Maltese capital deserves a special visit. We'll make a stop at Saint John's Co-Cathedral.

Description.Title: VALLETTA (Malta)
Description.Text:
This morning's excursion will be visiting typical villages on the southern edge of the island. A world away from the bustling capital, you'll discover the slower pace of many of the island's typical seaside villages. Our first stop will be Marsaxlokk, a traditional fishing village. Its isolated location and deep waters has made it a strategic island location over the centuries. Then we'll go to Siggiewi. The patron saint of the village is Saint Nicholas of Bari, and the church built in his honor is one of the most beautiful examples of baroque architecture on the island. When we stop at an olive grove, we'll learn about the various methods of growing and harvesting olives throughout the centuries. Enjoy a tasting of the local products. Next stop: Zebbug, one of the oldest towns on the island. Mostly famous for its city gate and the parish church, the town gets its name from the large olive groves that use to stand around the current location of the town center (zebbug means olive in Maltese).

In the afternoon, join us for a tour of Mdina and Rabat. Mdina is a veritable open-air museum. The ancient Maltese capital holds many treasures, among them several of the most beautiful homes in the country. You'll step back in time strolling through the labyrinth of streets lined with impressive palaces. We'll then head to Rabat, with archaeological relics testifying to the town's importance during the Roman period. We'll visit Saint Paul's Catacombs, the earliest and largest archaeological evidence of Christianity in Malta.

Description.Title: VALLETTA (Malta)
Description.Text:
This morning's excursion will be visiting typical villages on the southern edge of the island. A world away from the bustling capital, you'll discover the slower pace of many of the island's typical seaside villages.

In the afternoon, join us for a tour of Mdina and Rabat. Mdina is a veritable open-air museum. Description.Title: SYRACUSE (Sicily)
Description.Text:
In the morning, join us for a tour of Syracuse and Ortigia. One of the most fascinating cities in Sicily awaits us today. The 2,700-year-old city of Syracuse played a key role in ancient times, when it was one of the major powers of the Mediterranean world. We'll discover the unique site of the Necropolis of Pantalica, and visit Ortygia, the small island which is the historical center of the city. You'll come across the majestic ruins of the Greek Temple of Apollo, the Piazza Archimede, and the Piazza Duomo, an elliptical open space lined with harmonious and impressive buildings.

This afternoon, come with us on an excursion to Noto. Noto and its church were declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2002. Totally destroyed by the 1693 Sicilian earthquake, the current town was built on the left bank of River Asinaro, about 8 miles from the previous town. Enjoy a stroll through the historical center and admire the buildings, do a bit of souvenir shopping, or enjoy a snack at a local cafe.

Tonight is our gala dinner and evening.

Description.Title: SYRACUSE (Sicily)
Description.Text:
In the morning, join us for a tour of Syracuse and Ortigia. We'll discover the unique site of the Necropolis of Pantalica, and visit Ortygia, the small island which is the historical center of the city.

This afternoon, come with us on an excursion to Noto. Noto and its church were declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2002. Enjoy a stroll through the historical center and admire the buildings.

Tonight is our gala dinner and evening.

Description.Text: Enjoy breakfast on board this morning before disembarking at 9:00 a.m. End of our services.

Description.Title: CATANIA
Description.Text: Enjoy breakfast on board this morning before disembarking at 9:00 a.m. End of our services.
Exclusive cruise: The Best of the Mediterranean with Malta and Sicily

Description.Title: Our strengths
Description.Text: Embark on a cruise from Malta to Sicily, across tremendous landscapes and historical sites. Discover Malta through its architectural and cultural treasures and Sicily through nature and archaeology. Enjoy two excursions along the Cyclopean Coast or the island of Gozo, little sister island of Malta with undeniable charm.

Description.Title: Highlights
Description.Text:
CRUISE HIGHLIGHTS

  • Original and exclusive itinerary
  • EXCURSIONS INCLUDED:
    • The Cyclopean Coast
    • One day on the island of Gozo
  • Malta, a patchwork of cultures with unequaled treasures
    • Megalithic ruins, baroque architecture, and superb natural sites
  • Sicily, the best that Italy has to offer:
    • Gorgeous landscapes with a deep archaeological history
  • Great discoveries:
    • Malta and its rich cultural heritage
    • The best the Mediterranean has to offer
    • Valletta, the island's capital
    • The neighboring island of Gozo
    • The antique ruins and picturesque villages of Sicily
    • Mount Etna Volcano
    • Historical Syracuse

Description.Title: This offer includes
Description.Text: Your cruise with all meals from dinner the first evening to breakfast on the final day - all onboard drinks included (except for drinks from our special lists) - accommodations in double-occupancy cabin with shower in private bathroom - welcome cocktail - gala evening - excursions mentioned in the program - assistance from our onboard, multi-lingual host/hostess - travel assistance/repatriation insurance - all port fees.

Description.Title: This offer does not include
Description.Text: Transfers to/from departure/arrival points - drinks from our special lists, or drinks ordered during excursions or transfers - cancellation and baggage insurance.

Description.Title: At sea

Description.Title: At sea
Description.Text: We'll spend the entire day at sea.

Description.Title: KATAKOLON (Greece)
Description.Text:
In the morning, we'll set out on a tour of Olympia, the birthplace and host of the Olympic Games beginning in 776 B.C. Running, wrestling, boxing and chariot racing were all once part of this legendary event. The Altis - the sanctuary to the gods - contains one of the highest concentrations of masterpieces from the ancient Greek world. Enclosed within the area are the Temple of Hera, the Temple of Zeus, the Pelopion, and the altar where the sacrifices were made. The museum presents some of the most beautiful objects and remarkable sculptures found in the ruins.
We'll spend the afternoon cruising. Join us for an evening of dinner and dancing.

Running, wrestling, boxing and chariot racing were all once part of this legendary event. The museum presents some of the most beautiful objects and remarkable sculptures found in the ruins.
We'll spend the afternoon cruising. Join us for an evening of dinner and dancing.

Description.Title: ITEA - CORINTH
Description.Text: Join us for an excursion to Delphi (lunch included), a sacred site said to have been founded by Zeus. In ancient Greece, thousands upon thousands of pilgrims flocked here to hear the Oracle give her predictions. Although the Sanctuary of Apollo is arguably one of the most important historical sites in Greece, only the monumental pedestals remain today as silent witnesses to a lost grandeur. We'll visit the museum housing many of the important relics discovered in the area. Our tour will continue at Hosios Loukas, one of the most important monuments of Middle Byzantine architecture and art, which has also been listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. After our day, we'll begin to cruise to Corinth. Join us for an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: CORINTH - Corinth Canal - PIRAEUS
Description.Text:
We'll spend the morning cruising, passing through the Corinth Canal. After a failed effort to build it in the 1st century, the project finally saw the light of day in the 1800s. It is 4 miles long (6.4 km) and 70 feet wide (24.6 m) at its base, making it impassable for most modern ships.
Our afternoon excursion will be a tour of Athens and the Acropolis. We'll explore the Acropolis, an ancient religious center in Athens including the Temple of Athena Nike and the Caryatid Porch of the Erechtheion. Of course, the Parthenon dedicated to the goddess Athena, whom the people of Athens considered their patron, is not to be missed. After our visit to the Acropolis, enjoy a coach tour of the capital of Greece. Tonight's festivities will have a Greek flair!

Description.Title: SANTORINI
Description.Text: This morning, join us for a tour of Santorini. Santorini's intrigue reaches deep into the past. It is famous for dramatic views, stunning sunsets, white eggplants, and its very own active volcano. The small island cradles a rich variety of landscapes and bright white village architecture. We'll stop at a local winery to have a taste* of the island's famous wine. We'll spend the afternoon cruising. Join us for an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: SANTORINI
Description.Text: This morning, join us for a tour of Santorini. Santorini's intrigue reaches deep into the past. It is famous for dramatic views, stunning sunsets, white eggplants, and its very own active volcano. The small island cradles a rich variety of landscapes and bright white village architecture. We'll stop at a local winery to have a taste* of the island's famous wine. We'll spend the afternoon cruising. Join us for an evening of entertainment.

Description.Title: RHODES
Description.Text: This morning, join us for a visit to ancient and medieval Rhodes. We'll first visit the oldest part of the city, surrounded by medieval walls with seven gates. Strolling its hauntingly pretty cobbled lanes is an experience not to be missed. The Old City of Rhodes, which is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, remains one of the most impressive places in Greece. Within the enormous castle "The Palace of the Grandmaster” are relics from the medieval period as well as ancient sculptures and beautiful 1st century floor mosaics brought to Rhodes from the island of Kos. A stroll through the castle will bring you through several thousand years of history. Our tour will continue on the Street of the Knights: Completely restored or preserved beautifully, it is lined by the buildings where holy warriors spent their time in prayer or military practice. Each building is an ‘inn' for each language spoken according to the knights' birthplace: England, France, Germany, Italy, Aragon, Auvergne or Provence. What we see now, though, owes much to Italian restorations during the 1930s. Join us for an evening of dinner and dancing.

Description.Title: LIMASSOL
Description.Text:
We'll spend the morning cruising.
This afternoon, join us for a visit to the archaeological site in Paphos. Kato Pafos Archaeological Park includes sites and monuments from prehistoric times to the Middle Ages, with most dating from the Roman period. It became a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1980. The remains of villas, palaces, theaters, fortresses, and tombs mean that the site is of exceptional architectural and historic value. We'll visit the impressive, underground tombs dating back to the 4th century BC and sporting a distinct Egyptian influence. Afterwards, we'll continue on to the coastal town of Yeroskipou and visit a Loukoum (Turkish Delight) factory for a tasting. Tonight is our festive gala evening.
